Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
• Develop and maintain applied engineering tools required for aerodynamic and performance
analyses, design and test
• Aerodynamic design of unmanned air vehicles/missiles at conceptual, preliminary, and detail
design maturities
• Aerodynamic analysis of unmanned air vehicles, using both low and high order methods
• Stability and control analysis
• Aircraft performance modeling and simulation
• Aerodynamic loads generation

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• BS or higher degree in Aerospace Engineering
• Strong programming skills in higher-level languages (MATLAB, Python) in a version-controlled
environment (preferably git) and comfortable with low level languages (C, C++, Fortran)
• Tools development experience with established development roadmap, release schedules and
test procedures. UI/UX experience to promote adoption for non-expert user base through code
readability, documentation of theory and usage with examples
• Experience implementing physics based problems in computational framework using efficient
numerical methods (eg. vectorization, factorization, parallelization, etc)
• Understanding of fluid mechanics, aerodynamics and flight dynamics
• Experience preparing formal documentation (i.e., specifications, test procedures, technical
reports, etc.)
• Passion for defending the United States and her allies
• Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Minor in computer science or other computational engineering experience
• Experience with aircraft sizing and configuration trade studies, including aerodynamic design,
shaping, and multidisciplinary design analysis and optimization (MDAO)
• Experience with transonic and supersonic flow regimes
• Experience with a variety of aerodynamic analysis techniques including hand calculations, vortex
lattice methods, panel methods, and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)
• Experience with aircraft performance analysis and predictions
• Test experience including data acquisition, data analysis and project coordination
• Ability to obtain and hold an active U.S. Secret security clearance
US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Own hardware from concept generation to real world use
Use first principles physics as a basis for every decision
Lead design reviews, run analysis, visit vendors, define and execute hardware test plans
Build prototypes, analyze failures, and transition successful projects into production
Support critical hardware demonstrations with customers as needed
Travel to test sites as needed


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience in an immersive technical project (collegiate project teams or professional settings)
5+ years of technical engineering experience in a professional experience
CAD skills (any platform) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet industry standards
Demonstrated hands-on fabrication skills
Experience with complex vehicle systems (propulsion, gearboxes, actuators, etc.)
High competence with, and fluid use of, engineering first principles
BS, M.Eng, MS or PhD in an engineering field
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. security clearance
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience in NX/Teamcenter
Experience with composite design, analysis and testing
Ability to integrate electronic components into mechanical designs (motors, controllers, sensors etc.)
Experience with machining, sheet metal, injection molding, and 3D printing
Experience with aircraft design, development and test
Strong hands on technical skills - both professional and hobby

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Reading and interpreting technical blueprints and design models.
Programming/set-up/operation of CNC multi-axis milling and multi-axis turning machines.
Design/spec out and implement various work holding and fixture methods.
Ability to troubleshoot issues and make adjustments during the manufacturing process.
Perform quality control both during and at completion of the manufacturing process.
Help clean and maintain CNC equipment.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years experience as a programmer using cam software such as Esprit or Hypermill (willing to train).
3+ years experience as a machine setup/operator.
Clear understanding of G and M code.
High level of familiarity with multi-axis and 3D machining.
Experience with 5 axis milling, live tooling lathes, mill-turns and/or multi task machines.
Experience with Fanuc, Siemens or Brother controls.
High level of familiarity with various alloys, metals, plastics, etc. Ex: inconel, titanium, nickel-based alloys. 
High level of tooling and fixture experience.
High level of GD&T knowledge.
Ability to take ownership of entire manufacturing process from start to finish
Ability to adapt between R&D and short production.
Ability to multi-task.
Ability to lift up to 50lbs unassisted. 
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
5-axis simultaneous programming
Experience with CAD software like Solidworks and Siemens NX (Teamcenter)
CMM experience (PC-DIMIS)

$30—$54 USD

5-axis simultaneous set-up and operation experience.
5-axis Gantry experience

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Function as a member of an interdisciplinary team capable of executing static, dynamic, fatigue, thermal and vibration testing on all of Anduril’s product lines
Test items ranging from small integrated electronics systems to whole aircraft fuselages
Operate thermal chambers, vibration tables, data acquisition systems and structural testing equipment as needed to execute test objectives
Lead design reviews, run analysis, visit vendors, define and execute hardware test plans
Build test equipment, implement test automation, analyze failures and execute qualification campaigns
Support critical hardware demonstrations with customers as needed
Travel to test sites as needed
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
3+ years of professional experience in a related engineering field
Experience in an immersive interdisciplinary technical project (collegiate project teams or professional settings)
CAD skills (any platform) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet common industry standards
Experience in hardware automation and software-hardware communication/integration
Demonstrated hands on fabrication skills
High competence with and fluid use of engineering first principles
BS, MS or PhD in an engineering discipline
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with hands-on electrical engineering work
Experience in NX/Teamcenter
Knowledge of scripting language to develop automation. Python, Matlab, etc.
Ability to integrate electronic components into mechanical designs (motors, controllers, sensors etc.)
Experience with machining, sheet metal, injection molding, and 3D printing

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril is looking for a Water Jet Operator to join our team. Our manufacturing development team is responsible for rapidly iterating and building cutting-edge defense hardware, including static equipment, moving ground equipment, and flight vehicles. This team’s responsibility includes sheet metal processing, engineering design, and manufacturing procedures.

The ideal candidate for this role has a track record of taking ownership in solving fabrication challenges. They have creatively devised physical solutions, either personally manufacturing them or overseeing the manufacturing process. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, this role is for you.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Process sheet metal parts utilizing water jet cutting, and various other machine tools
Perform quality checks on completed products
Troubleshoot issues with the equipment
Maintain equipment
Follow OSHA safety guidelines
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Reading and interpreting blue prints and drawing
3+ years experience in a R&D environment
3+ years experience programming, operating and maintaining a OMAX or equivalent water jet cutting machine
Ability to work through R&D tasks with limited oversight (evaluate, obtain materials, execute)
High familiarity with various materials (metallic, plastic, composites, foam, etc)
High mechanical aptitude
Ability to multi-task
Ability to lift 50 pounds 
Ability to stand for long periods of time
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
High familiarity around 5-axis water jet cutting
CAD (SolidWorks, NX)
CNC press brake experience
CNC laser cutting experience
General knowledge with AC and DC electrical systems
US Hourly Range
$26.90—$40 USD

Develop fuel, lubrication and fluid systems for piston and turbine engine applications including custom pumps, valves, manifolds integrated engine castings, heat exchangers, electrical devices for fluid handling and sensor packages.
Develop test equipment and conduct component performance testing of pumps and fluid handling systems.
Build prototypes, analyze failures, and transition successful projects into production, this role owns hardware from concept generation to real world use.
Lead design reviews, run analysis, visit vendors, define and execute hardware test plans
Conduct system level testing on the engine dyno or thrust stand

Work on the coolest engines in the aviation business

5-7 years of experience designing, building, and commissioning complex fluid systems.
CAD skills (any platform but NX preferred) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet common industry standards.
Demonstrated hands-on fabrication skills
High competence with, and fluid use of, engineering first principles
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril has been selected as one of five vendors chosen to develop Collaborative Combat Aircraft (CCA) for the Air Force's flagship autonomous aircraft program. We are honored to be the only non-traditional defense company selected to be a part of the program and we are seeking highly motivated engineers to join us in the rapid development of a new, revolutionary aircraft.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Assist in the design and development of low observable unmanned air vehicles
Perform signature management analysis in both RF and IR spectrums
Develop analysis tools, workflows, and validation processes for signature predictions and validation
Select, develop and test Low Observable materials to determine physical, electrical, and/or environmental properties
Aid in the development of manufacturing plans for Low Observable air vehicles, including infrastructure, materials, component fabrication, and assembly processes
Plan and execute RCS testing of Low Observable air vehicles and components
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of Low Observables experience on air vehicles
Proficient knowledge of Low Observables, survivability, and susceptibility
Experience with LO modeling and prediction tools, such as Computational Electromagnetics (CEM) tools, Method of Moments (MoM), HFSS, CST Microwave Studio, COAST, SENTRi, Xpatch, FEKO
Familiarity with Low Observable materials and manufacturing processes
Experience with Low Observable airframe design, treatments, and subsystem integrations
Experience designing mechanical parts (CAD). Understanding of manufacturing methods (machining, sheet metal, composites, 3D printing, injection molding, composite lamination, etc)
Experience with RCS testing of LO component and/or air vehicles
BS or higher degree in STEM discipline
Must possess and be able to maintain an active U.S. Top Secret security clearance.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience manufacturing Low Observable components, including materials and edges
Experience with designing LO apertures
Hands-on maintenance experience with Low Observable aircraft
Experience in NX/Teamcenter

Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Develop and integrate hardware on unmanned air vehicles
Own designs from concept generation to real world use
Use first principles physics as a basis for every decision
Lead design reviews, run analysis, visit vendors, define and execute hardware test plans
Build prototypes, analyze failures, and transition successful projects into production
Support critical hardware demonstrations with customers as needed
Travel to test sites as needed
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years of mechanical engineering experience on air vehicles (manned or unmanned)
Experience integrating electrical and mechanical subsystems into unmanned air vehicles
Experience designing mechanical parts (CAD). Understanding of manufacturing methods (machining, sheet metal, composites, 3D printing, injection molding, composite lamination, etc)
High competence with, and fluid use of, engineering first principles
BS or higher degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or Electrical Engineering
Must possess and be able to maintain an active U.S. Top Secret security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in NX/Teamcenter
Experience developing aircraft subsystem layouts, performing architectural trade studies, and evaluating vendor performance data
Competency in engineering analysis, including structural, thermal, and electrical
Active U.S. Secret security clearance
US Salary Range
$120,000—$200,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
• Own hardware design (CAD, hand calculations, prototypes, etc) from concept generation to
launch. Intelligently pace design maturity with an holistic view of the program.
• Use first principles as a basis for every decision. Continuously look for opportunities to simplify
designs.
• Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to design and packaging
considerations. Strong focus on good architecture to ensure designs are robust in nature.
• Lead subsystem design reviews, present structures status to other team members, provide clear
understanding of timelines and technical status.
• Act as the Responsible Engineer for your subsystem: Run analysis, visit vendors, define and
execute hardware test plans.
• Build prototypes, analyze failures, and transition successful prototype designs to flight hardware
and low rate production.
• Travel to test sites and vendors as needed.
• Create excellent technical documentation – slide packages, test plans and reports, procedures,
assembly instructions, part and assembly drawings, vendor specifications and statements of
work, etc.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• BS or higher degree in engineering or a hard science.
• Experience in an immersive hands-on technical project (collegiate project teams and/or
professional settings).
• CAD skills (any platform) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet
common industry standards.
• Demonstrated hands-on fabrication and assembly skills. Experience working with hand tools,
mill, lathe, etc.
• Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals: heat transfer, statics, solid mechanics,
materials.
• Excellent attention to detail
• Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision.
• Very organized and willing to establish scope and requirements for ill-defined problems.
• Passion for defending the United States and her allies.
• Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• 2+ years of mechanical design experience in a professional setting with space hardware or
industry of equivalent complexity.
• Experience in NX/Teamcenter and Solidworks.
• Ability to integrate electronic components (PCBAs, motors, sensors etc.) into mechanical designs.
• Experience working with (integrating in designs) optical or RF systems.
• Experience developing code in higher-level languages (e.g. Python, MATLAB, C++) for developing
analytical models and data acquisition and automation.
• Structural or thermal testing experience – sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-
processing (Python preferred)
US Salary Range
$120,000—$213,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Utilize first principle methods and design tools to develop new aircraft products
Own development of preliminary and detailed design of landing gear system components including design of oleo struts, braking systems, wheels, tires, metallic structures, locks, actuators and mechanisms.
Perform complex modelling and finite element analysis at the detailed component and assembly level
Conduct trade studies and perform design and analysis research of complex engineering concepts to determine an optimal solution for weight, performance, manufacturability, cost, and/or schedule
Collaborate in a multidisciplinary environment to solve complex, open-ended problems with an emphasis on schedule and cost objectives
Coordinate work with airframe, systems integration, modeling and simulation, aerodynamics, electrical, manufacturing, project engineering, external vendors, and other team members
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s or higher degree in engineering or a related technical degree with a focus on structures
5+ years of experience in aircraft design
Strong technical knowledge in core engineering principles, component design, stress analysis, testing, and fabrication
High competence in landing gear design fundamentals, system analysis, dynamics, load paths, and manufacturing
Ability to create parts, assemblies and drawings using 3D CAD software such as NX.
Proficient in creating drawings per ASM Y14.5
Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills
US DoD Secret Clearance or higher (or ability to obtain and maintain such a clearance)
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Proficiency with NX CAD and SimCenter, Nastran, Ansys or Abaqus analysis software
Experience with fast paced prototype design and manufacture of uncrewed aircraft
Experience supporting ground and flight testing of complex systems
Broad experience across a range of aircraft mechanical systems
Hands-on experience with test qualification of landing gear components (such as oleo strut, structural members, or brakes)
Detailed knowledge of various actuation systems (such as hydraulic manifolds, valves, and fittings, as well as motors, gearboxes, and motor controllers)
Practical aircraft knowledge (pilots license, A&P, etc.)
  US Salary Range
$140,000—$213,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Lead Anduril’s efforts to achieve munition, warhead, and fuzing certification by chaperoning programs through the relevant review entities (WSERB, FISTRP, SSSTRP) and creating positive and enduring relationships with the review entities.
Create, review, manage, and present critical documentation packages internally and to customers and fuze/safety boards.
Engage with technical and business line teams and individuals to ensure safety/certification information is accurate and thorough
Plan and document testing, analysis, and review milestones to ensure we are taking a proactive approach and minimizing the timeline to go through the review process
Document root cause and corrective actions that are relevant to the review process
Oversee updates to project deliverables including requirements documentation, change control, traceability, and reliability matrices.
Create frameworks and establish precedent for government reviews and system certifications to aid future programs.
Flow down similar guidance and manage as needed key vendors (ESAD, warhead, etc.) where needed
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or higher degree in mechanical, electrical, aerospace, or another engineering discipline
5+ work experience in design, safety, certification, and systems engineering of an ordnance system
Warhead/fuze review board experience
Munitions system certification or qualification experience
Experience in program management, customer and vendor management, and managing schedules and budgets
Ability to travel as required up to 25%
Experience preparing formal documentation (i.e. specifications, test procedures, technical reports, etc.)
Excellent written and slide documentation with an astute eye for clarity and accuracy
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Active U.S. Secret or Top Secret security clearance
Experience planning and executing munitions field tests, including data acquisition, data analysis, and project coordination
Prior experience in EOD or handling munitions products
Experience developing or testing complex electrical or mechatronics systems
US Salary Range
$140,000—$185,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. WHAT YOU’LL DO
Assist in research and development regarding design of aircraft engines, engine components, advanced combustion and fuel injection systems.
Specify, design, fabricate, install, and test prototype components and control systems.
Specify, design, and install instrumentation on test assets for data acquisition.
Collect, organize, and post-process test data to generate test reports with conclusions with recommendations for further work.
Lead and participate in continuous improvement activities, including process improvement, efficiency improvement and development of data analysis techniques
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or higher degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or Electrical Engineering
Knowledge of fundamentals of internal combustion engines.
Exposure to testing of engines, or powertrain components.
Practical experience with diagnostics monitoring, failure detection and data analysis.
Mechatronics experience; sensor selection, design and assembly of actuators, setup of data acquisition systems, assemble wire harnesses and debug/troubleshoot systems.
Experience designing mechanical parts (CAD). Understanding of manufacturing methods (machining, sheet metal, composites, 3D printing, injection molding, etc.)
Experience procuring parts and working in a machine shop. Working knowledge of machine safety and shop safety protocols.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge and experience working with Engine Management Systems (EMS), OEM or motorsport.
Understanding of engine dynamometer operation including testing practices, instrumentation, and calculations
Practical or professional experience with internal combustion engines.

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
We are looking for a Turbomachinery Engineer to enhance our Propulsion Development team. This role is critical in developing and optimizing advanced propulsion systems to meet our aggressive and innovative goals. You will be responsible for developing and qualifying air breathing propulsion systems along with supporting flight testing as needed.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Own critical turbomachinery components and be responsible for every aspect of the turbomachinery design and analysis, demonstrating ownership and work in close collaboration with manufacturing and assembly.
Assist in research and development regarding design of aircraft engines, engine components, advanced combustion and fuel injection systems.
Conduct aerodynamic and thermodynamic analysis to evaluate new and existing designs.
Ensure that turbomachinery solutions are developed to meet challenging manufacturing goals, minimum cost/weight and on an aggressive schedule.
Lead projects from conception through to testing and validation.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering
A minimum of 5 years of experience in turbomachinery engineering
Knowledge of fundamentals of internal combustion engines.
Creation and maintenance of 3D models of compressor geometry.
Exposure to testing of engines, or powertrain components.
Proven expertise in the aerodynamics and thermodynamics of turbomachinery.
Professional experience using Siemens NX (Unigraphics) or other CAD packages
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data

Professional experience designing, testing, or flying air-breathing combustors, augmentors, ignition systems, variable area nozzles, or turbomachinery.

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. We are seeking an experienced Laboratory Technician to play a critical role in our materials engineering efforts. This individual will be responsible for processing and analyzing metallic components. Your expertise will contribute directly to the integrity and performance of our turbine engines.

What You’ll Do:
Prepare metallic samples for analysis by precision sectioning, mounting, grinding, polishing, and etching
Operate and maintain lab equipment, ensuring all devices are calibrated and functioning according to industry standards
Work closely with the propulsion design team to meet material requirements for turbine engine components
Execute meticulous quality inspections and provide detailed reports on findings
Document inspection results and provide detailed reports for engineering review
Maintain a clean, orderly, and safe laboratory environment, upholding all health and safety protocols
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
3-5 years of hands-on experience in a metallurgical and materials laboratory
Proficient in metallic sample preparation and testing
Strong understanding of metallography and material properties
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and with minimal oversight
Detail-oriented with strong organizational capabilities
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Proficient with common hand tools and light power tools
Ability to rapidly change roles/responsibilities while working in a fast paced, challenging work environment
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience within the defense or aerospace sectors, particularly relating to turbine engines
Understanding of aerospace industry quality standards
Certifications in NDT techniques, such as ASNT Level II or equivalent in penetrant testing and eddy current testing
Prior hands on experience with kit, model, or experimental aircraft builds
Forklift certification
An Associate’s degree in Materials Science, Metallurgy, or related discipline
Piece part fabrication experience including sheet metal (waterjet, press brake, etc.), and subtractive manufacturing (machining)
US Hourly Range
$30—$46 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril has been selected as one of five vendors chosen to develop Collaborative Combat Aircraft (CCA) for the Air Force's flagship autonomous aircraft program. We are honored to be the only non-traditional defense company selected to be a part of the program and we are seeking highly motivated engineers to join us in the rapid development of a new, revolutionary aircraft.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Aerodynamic design of unmanned air vehicles/missiles at conceptual, preliminary, and detail
design maturities
Aerodynamic analysis of unmanned air vehicles, using both low and high order methods,
including analysis tool development and improvement as needed
Stability and control analysis
Aircraft performance modeling and simulation
Aerodynamic loads generation
Wind tunnel test planning, execution, and analysis
Flight test planning, execution, and analysis

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or higher degree in Aerospace Engineering
5+ work experience as an individual contributing engineer
Experience with aircraft sizing and configuration trade studies, including aerodynamic design,
shaping, and multidisciplinary design optimization (MDO)
Competent in a variety of aerodynamic analysis techniques including hand calculations, vortex
lattice methods, panel methods, and computational fluid dynamics (CFD)
Experience with aircraft performance analysis and predictions
Test experience including data acquisition, data analysis and project coordination
Strong programming skills in higher-level languages (e.g., MATLAB, Python) for internal tool
development in a version-controlled environment
Experience preparing formal documentation (i.e., specifications, test procedures, technical
reports, etc.)
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
StarCCM+ experience
Experience with transonic and supersonic flow regimes
Active U.S. Secret security clearance
      US Salary Range
$142,000—$213,000 USD

Job Title: Senior Aircraft Loads and Dynamics Engineer
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Develop structural loads analysis for multiple air vehicles and systems to ensure structural integrity under various flight and ground conditions
Generate and maintain integrated dynamics FEMs for multiple vehicles for use in loads derivation, aeroelastic flutter and other analyses
Conduct aeroelastic and aeroservoelastic studies to predict and verify aircraft behavior
Conduct flutter analysis to inform vehicle design and ensure flight safety
Generate flight loads data in accordance with MIL and FAR specifications, such as FAR 23, 25, JSSG-2006, and other relevant standards
Collaborate with design engineers to develop structural optimization strategies based on loads analysis results
Prepare detailed technical reports and present findings to internal teams, management, and external customers
Develop and perform dynamics testing, including vibration testing, modal testing, GVT, etc.
Define instrumentation and perform data processing for flight loads data acquisition
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or higher degree in engineering or applied physics with a focus in structures
Deep understanding of statics, dynamics, solid mechanics, materials science, finite element analysis and dynamic testing
5+ years of experience in a structures, dynamics or loads related role with high ownership and accountability for hardware outcomes
Proficiency in the use of FEMAP/Nastran or similar
Proficiency in Matlab or Python (or equivalent) for developing analytical models, data acquisition and automation
Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision
Very organized and willing to establish scope and requirements for ill-defined problems
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
A prior focus on an aircraft flight loads, aeroelastic or flutter analysis, including transonic flight
Ability to develop workflow automation tools
Familiarity developing loads or structural compliance for JSSG-2006, FAR 23, 25, or similar
Structural or dynamics testing experience (system identification, sine, random, shock, flight) – sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-processing
US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD

Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. Test items ranging from small integrated electronics systems to whole aircraft fuselages
Operate thermal chambers, vibration tables, data acquisition systems and structural testing equipment as needed to execute test objectives
Lead design reviews, run analysis, visit vendors, define and execute hardware test plans
Build test equipment, implement test automation, analyze failures and execute qualification campaigns
Support critical hardware demonstrations with customers as needed
Travel to test sites as needed
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years of professional experience in a related engineering field
Experience in an immersive interdisciplinary technical project (collegiate project teams or professional settings)
CAD skills (any platform) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet common industry standards
Experience in hardware automation and software-hardware communication/integration
Demonstrated hands on fabrication skills
High competence with and fluid use of engineering first principles
BS, MS or PhD in an engineering discipline
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data

Experience with hands-on electrical engineering work
Experience in NX/Teamcenter
Knowledge of scripting language to develop automation. Python, Matlab, etc.
Ability to integrate electronic components into mechanical designs (motors, controllers, sensors etc.)
Experience with machining, sheet metal, injection molding, and 3D printing

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Critical member of team for selection and integration of aircraft engines, engine components, and fuel systems on unmanned air vehicles
Design, fabricate, and test prototype components and control systems
Plan, instrument, and execute tests of aircraft propulsion systems
Coordinate with engine vendors, develop strategic partnerships, and manage development projects
Support critical hardware demonstrations with customers as needed
Critical member of team supporting CAD design for internal aerodynamic loft, surfaces and structures
Travel to test sites as needed
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of propulsion engineering experience on air vehicles (manned or unmanned)
Professional experience with jet engines in the 1,000-20,000 lbf thrust class.
Knowledge of jet engine fundamentals
Experience with use of engine cycle decks
Exposure to testing of engines or powertrain components
Experience designing mechanical parts and surface loft (CAD)
Understanding of manufacturing methods (machining, sheet metal, composites, 3D printing, injection molding, etc)
BS or higher degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or Electrical Engineering
Must possess and be able to maintain an active U.S. Top Secret security clearance
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in NX/Teamcenter
Hands-on experience with jet engine testing including test practices, instrumentation, and data processing
Knowledge and experience working with Engine Management Systems (EMS), OEM or motorsport
Experience procuring parts and working in a machine shop. Working knowledge of machine safety and shop safety protocols
Active U.S. Secret security clearance

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Perform hand calculations and spreadsheet first order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design or analysis. Use first principles as a basis for every decision
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to structural considerations. Strong focus on good architecture to ensure designs are robust in nature
Work with aero/CFD engineers and others to define loads for aircraft structure and subsystems
Generate and maintain integrated FEMs for flying vehicles. Astutely pace model maturity based on state of hardware design and program goals
Perform coupled aero-structural analysis on flight vehicle designs (flutter, aeroelastic, etc.)
Support flight vehicle structural certification efforts — whether requirements are defined by customer (SEEK EAGLE, FAR, etc.) or, in the absence of customer requirements, internally defined by logic and best practices (which you will help define)
Develop internal tools and reports for communicating loads and analysis results across teams
Present status at formal reviews with Customer and internally. Technical status, risk tracking, inputs to program planning, etc.
Interview other team members as projects grow in scope and complexity. Attract strong technical talent
Provide structural test inputs to help build out lab space and infrastructure
Create test models, define test loads, requirements and margins, and oversee structural testing
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s or higher degree in engineering or a hard science with a focus in structures
Deep understanding of statics, aeroelastic, solid mechanics, materials, finite element analysis, and dynamic testing
5+ years of experience designing and analyzing aircraft structures
Proficiency in the use of FEMAP/Nastran
Structural and flight testing experience – sensor selection, data acquisition, data post processing (Python preferred)
Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision
Very organized and willing to establish scope and requirements for ill-defined problems
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Structural analysis or design experience on other complex hardware — rockets, satellites, etc.
Experience with rotorcraft
Experience developing code in higher level languages (e.g. Python, MATLAB, C++) for developing analytical models and data acquisition and automation
US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Use first principles as a basis for every decision and discern the right level of analysis to apply. Execute hand calculations, spreadsheet, and MATLAB/Python first-order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design.
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to structural considerations. Strong focus on good architecture to ensure designs are robust in nature.
Work to develop loads for aircraft structure and subsystems.
Generate and maintain integrated FEMs for flying vehicles. Astutely pace model maturity based on state of hardware design and program goals.

Support flight vehicle structural certification efforts — whether requirements are defined by customer (SEEK EAGLE, FAR, etc.) or, in the absence of customer requirements, internally defined by logic and best practices (which you will help define).
Develop internal tools and reports for communicating loads and analysis results across teams.
Present status at formal reviews with Customer and internally. Technical status, risk tracking, inputs to program planning, etc.
Create test models; define test loads, requirements, and margins; and oversee structural testing at all phases of design.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or higher degree in engineering or a hard science with a focus in structures
Deep understanding of statics, aeroelastic, solid mechanics, materials, finite element analysis, and dynamic testing
5+ years of experience designing and analyzing aircraft or missile structures
Proficiency in the use of FEMAP/Nastran
Structural and flight testing experience – sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-processing (Python preferred)
Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision
Very organized and willing to establish scope and requirements for ill-defined problems
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with rotorcraft
Experience developing code in higher-level languages (e.g. Python, MATLAB, C++) for developing analytical models and data acquisition and automation

Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:
  Utilize first principle methods and design tools to develop new aircraft products
Own development of primary and secondary aircraft structural parts and assemblies (metallic and composite) from preliminary design through prototype manufacturing
Perform complex modelling and finite element analysis at the detailed component level, major assembly level, and aircraft level (analysis simulations to include strength, buckling, damage tolerance, and delamination)
Apply design for manufacturing concepts to create solutions that are cost effective and easy to manufacture at rate
Conduct trade studies and perform design and analysis research of complex engineering concepts to determine an optimal solution for weight, performance, manufacturability, cost, and/or schedule
Collaborate in a multidisciplinary environment to solve complex, open-ended problems with an emphasis on schedule and cost objectives
Coordinate work with mechanical systems, systems integration, aerodynamics, manufacturing, project engineering, and other team members
Onsite engineering support at manufacturing and integration sites
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  B.S. in Aerospace Engineering or Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent experience
10+ years of experience in aerospace or related industry
Siemens NX proficiency
Strong technical knowledge in core engineering principles, fundamental mechanics of composite materials, design, analysis, testing, and fabrication
Deep understanding of load paths, design practices, and hand calculations to design robust structurally efficient assemblies
Proven ability to design high performance structures and execute their fabrication
Self-directed, results oriented, and capable of working in a dynamic environment
Excellent time management, organizational, and communication skills
US DoD Secret Clearance or higher (or ability to obtain and maintain such a clearance)
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  15+ years of experience in aerospace or related industry
Experience with fast paced prototype design and manufacture of uncrewed aircraft
Broad experience across a range of aircraft programs
Hands-on experience with manufacturing
Practical aircraft knowledge (pilots license, A&P, etc.)
        US Salary Range
$160,000—$225,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Own the thermal design and analysis of a hardware development program.
Use first principles as a basis for every decision and discern the right level of analysis to apply. Execute hand calculations, spreadsheet, and MATLAB/Python first-order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design.
Define good thermal architecture to withstand rugged environments. Define hot, cold, and any other edge cases that need to be analyzed based on industry standards and intended use.
Work with engineers in other disciplines to document power dissipations under different operating modes.
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to thermal considerations.
Own the thermal FEA/CFD models and predict system performance. Define red/yellow design limits for test and operation.
Define and execute prototype builds and tests to verify thermal designs (do CAD, select sensors and DAQ equipment, post-process data, summarize results, etc.).
Present thermal status at formal reviews internally and with customers. Provide clear understanding of timelines and technical status.
Develop internal tools to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of analysis.
Support failure reviews and root-cause analysis with test data and thermal analysis.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Currently pursuing or have obtained a MS or higher degree in engineering or applied physics with focus on heat transfer and fluid dynamics
In-depth understanding of heat transfer and fluid dynamics
5+ years of experience designing thermal systems for integrated hardware products
Practical experience designing passive and active thermal management systems
Thermal testing experience –sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-processing
Thermal FEA experience –STAR-CCM+, ANSYS, Icepak, or Flotherm
CAD experience with SolidWorks or Siemens NX
Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience developing code in higher-level languages like Python or MATLAB for applications like lumped thermal capacitance steady state and transient analysis
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance.
US Salary Range
$150,000—$200,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Job Title: Senior Thermal Engineer – Aircraft and Missiles
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Own the thermal design and analysis of a drone, aircraft, or missile.
Use first principles as a basis for every decision and discern the right level of analysis to apply. Execute hand calculations, spreadsheet, and MATLAB/Python first-order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design.
Define good thermal architecture to withstand rugged environments and demanding flight envelopes. Define hot, cold, and any other edge cases that need to be analyzed based on industry standards and intended use.
Work with engineers in other disciplines to document power dissipations under different operating modes.
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to thermal considerations.
Own the thermal FEA/CFD models and predict system performance. Define red/yellow design limits for test and operation.
Define and execute prototype builds and tests to verify thermal designs (do CAD, select sensors and DAQ equipment, post-process data, summarize results, etc.).
Present thermal status at formal reviews internally and with customers. Provide clear understanding of timelines and technical status.
Develop internal tools to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of analysis.
Support failure reviews and root-cause analysis with test data and thermal analysis.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Currently pursuing or have obtained a MS or higher degree in engineering or applied physics with focus on heat transfer and fluid dynamics
In-depth understanding of heat transfer and fluid dynamics
Experience in the aerospace industry and an aircraft, rocket, or missile program
5+ years of experience designing thermal systems for integrated hardware products
Practical experience designing passive and active thermal management systems
Thermal testing experience –sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-processing
Thermal FEA experience –STAR-CCM+, ANSYS, Icepak, or Flotherm
CAD experience with SolidWorks or Siemens NX
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience developing code in higher-level languages like Python or MATLAB for applications like lumped thermal capacitance steady state and transient analysis
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance.
US Salary Range
$140,000—$185,000 USD

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Perform hand calculations and spreadsheet first order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design or analysis. Use first principles as a basis for every decision
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to structural considerations. Strong focus on good architecture to ensure designs are robust in nature
Work with aero/CFD engineers and others to define loads for aircraft structure and subsystems
Generate and maintain integrated FEMs for flying vehicles. Astutely pace model maturity based on state of hardware design and program goals
Perform coupled aero-structural analysis on flight vehicle designs (flutter, aeroelastic, etc.)
Support flight vehicle structural certification efforts — whether requirements are defined by customer (SEEK EAGLE, FAR, etc.) or, in the absence of customer requirements, internally defined by logic and best practices (which you will help define)
Develop internal tools and reports for communicating loads and analysis results across teams
Present status at formal reviews with Customer and internally. Technical status, risk tracking, inputs to program planning, etc.
Interview other team members as projects grow in scope and complexity. Attract strong technical talent
Provide structural test inputs to help build out lab space and infrastructure
Create test models, define test loads, requirements and margins, and oversee structural testing
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s or higher degree in engineering or a hard science with a focus in structures
Deep understanding of statics, aeroelastic, solid mechanics, materials, finite element analysis, and dynamic testing
2+ years of experience designing and analyzing aircraft structures
Proficiency in the use of FEMAP/Nastran
Structural and flight testing experience – sensor selection, data acquisition, data post processing (Python preferred)
Highly motivated, self-starting, and able to perform duties autonomously without supervision
Very organized and willing to establish scope and requirements for ill-defined problems
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Structural analysis or design experience on other complex hardware — rockets, satellites, etc.
Experience with rotorcraft
Experience developing code in higher level languages (e.g. Python, MATLAB, C++) for developing analytical models and data acquisition and automation
US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.

401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Present thermal status at formal reviews internally and with customers. Provide clear understanding of timelines and technical status.
Develop internal tools to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of analysis.
Support failure reviews and root-cause analysis with test data and thermal analysis.

Currently pursuing or have obtained a MS or higher degree in engineering or applied physics with focus on heat transfer and fluid dynamics
Understanding of heat transfer and fluid dynamics
CAD experience with SolidWorks or Siemens NX
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data

0-5 years experience performing thermal analysis, or performing related research or education.
Experience developing code in higher-level languages like Python or MATLAB for applications like lumped thermal capacitance steady state and transient analysis
Thermal FEA experience –STAR-CCM+, ANSYS, Icepak, or Flotherm
Thermal testing experience –sensor selection, data acquisition, data post-processing

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. WHAT YOU’LL DO
Own the thermal design, analysis, test, and associated component vendor management of a space hardware development program.
Use first principles as a basis for every decision and discern the right level of analysis to apply. Execute hand calculations, spreadsheet, and MATLAB/Python first-order models to inform path forward before jumping into detailed design.
Define good thermal architecture to withstand the space environments. Define and quantify hot, cold, and any other edge cases that drive the system.
Communicate pros/cons of system architecture with respect to thermal considerations.
Present thermal status at formal reviews internally and with customers. Provide clear understanding of timelines and technical status.
Develop internal tools to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of analysis.
Develop a database of materials, thermal properties, and vendors of thermal hardware for use in space
Support failure reviews and root-cause analysis with test data and thermal analysis.

BS, MS, or higher degree in engineering or applied physics
Demonstrated knowledge of heat transfer in academic and/or professional setting
Proficiency in Thermal Desktop or equivalent thermal simulation tool
Hands on experience prototyping hardware and conducting thermal tests. Experience selecting instrumentation, post-processing data, correlating models
CAD experience with SolidWorks or Siemens NX
Passion for defending the United States and her allies
S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years professional experience as a thermal analyst using Thermal Desktop
Design or test experience on a space platform
Experience developing code in higher-level languages like Python or MATLAB for applications like lumped thermal capacitance steady state and transient analysis
Be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Design warheads and complex missile/ordnance systems and transition them from prototype to production.
Analyze lethality and performance using hand-calculations (Gurney equations) and multi-physics simulation tools (CTH, Sierra, Zapotec, etc.).
Manage field testing of munitions products from end-to-end, including project planning, design of experiments, and safety.
Capture test video, compile data from ground and flight tests, and analyze results.
Assemble/disassemble explosive test articles and precision targets.
