Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to root cause end user and infrastructure related issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Knowledge of both Windows and Linux systems, along with software installations
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. TS clearance

Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
We're seeking a product security engineer to develop novel security tooling, discover vulnerabilities, and ultimately secure our suite of advanced technologies including artificial intelligence systems, command and control platforms, aerospace vehicles, and long range sensors.

The ideal candidate has a background in electrical or software engineering, with a focus on platform security, or has pivoted to a product or application security role. They will be able to conduct complex security architecture reviews, research and mitigate exploits against hardware and software, and work with other engineering teams to build resiliency into our products.

Responsibilities:
Owns the development and maturation of security features for Anduril’s Electronic Warfare (EW) products
Collaborates and builds solutions with engineering teams to meet and exceed industry-standard security goals
Simulates attacks against Anduril’s products and integrated components to uncover potential weaknesses
Collaborates with manufacturing and operations teams to develop secure handling and operational processes
Engages with teams to remediate uncovered weakness in designs, implementations, integrations, and processes
Requirements:
Proficient with one or more programming languages (e.g. C/C++, Golang, Rust, Haskell)
Interest in and willingness to immerse in Software Defined Radio (SDR) technology
Experience assessing security of firmware, applications, network, IoT, or embedded systems
Experience developing features for and improving security of firmware, applications, network, or embedded systems
Experience building, testing, and delivering production-ready systems, especially for embedded and/or Linux systems
Familiarity with anti-tamper and reverse engineering mechanisms
Strong and professional communication skills (written and verbal)
Must possess and be able to maintain a U.S. Secret Security clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Excels at the above listed Requirements
Familiarity with security architectures of EW, aerospace, or cyber-physical systems
Expertise in the field of Software Defined Radio (SDR)
Experience with signals analysis tools and techniques
Familiarity with machine learning techniques for signal classification
Experience with programmable logic devices and their development tools
Regularly builds, tests, and delivers production-ready systems, especially for embedded and/or Linux systems
Possesses and be able to maintain a U.S. TS Security clearance
US Salary Range
$168,000—$252,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. The Business Systems team is responsible for building and improving the many business systems that enables Anduril to accomplish its mission. Anduril’s supply chain, accounting, sales & growth, engineering, field maintenance, quality, manufacturing, and many more teams rely on the technology built by us. We work across the company to ensure we have the tools and capabilities necessary for mission success.

As the Quality Applications Program Manager, you will be responsible for delivering solutions that enable the performance of Anduril’s many hardware products. To accomplish this, you will partner with multiple teams and systems that are responsible for the discovery, development, and delivery of quality performance. These teams include Quality Engineering, Reliability, Configuration Management, Production/Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Test & Evaluation, and more. You will have to develop a detailed understanding of each team’s challenges and requirements to understand what solutions can best address their needs. You will architect and develop solutions in partnership with technical teams and drive adoption & enable best practices for scale and efficiency. Because these teams have different use cases and timelines, you must be an agile, general-athlete style PM who can pivot from deep diving the intricacies of how one team executes a technical workflow, to closely examining the metrics of the systems to understand where the failure points are, to mapping an intertwined set of dependencies to build a roadmap, to updating executives on the current and future sets of your program all in the course of a single day.
Key Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Developing the program vision after synthesizing stakeholder requirements and feedback, and aligning with targeted business outcomes
Serve as the “single threaded leader” for the Quality / Product Performance initiative
Crafting a roadmap and ensuring that it is effectively decomposed for technical teams’ backlog
Communicating across stakeholders on your program's development and roadmap, as well as monitoring and reporting on program performance to understand if business outcomes are getting met
Driving adoption and enablement through the use of change management tools, schedules, and user engagement (UAT, training, sandbox environment, piloting, etc).
Required Characteristics:
Anduril is an extremely fast-paced defense technology startup that is rapidly scaling itself. Our culture is one of ambition, hard work, relentless pursuit of excellence, and deliberate disruption. The successful candidate will be one who demonstrates the follow core characteristics:
Bias for Action - they ask for forgiveness, not permission, and hate the idea of waiting around to be told what to do. They’ve never seen a wall you haven’t wanted to run through!
Outcome-Oriented - They determine what the business needs and work backwards from those outcomes, rather than working forwards from a particular system’s capabilities
Customer Focused - They display deep user empathy to boost engagement and build experiences that delight
Dive Deep - They sweat the details and roll up their sleeves to uncover the root causes for systemic issues. They eat metrics for breakfast!
Ownership - They care deeply not just about their program, but for all the business outcomes that their program supports, holding themselves accountable for everything it both does and fails to do
Agility - They change directions easily and without regret, quickly adapting to shifting business priorities
First Principles Thinking - They approach problems and develop solutions not based on what a vendor recommends or because it’s how they did things at their last job, but from a deep appreciation of what is best for the enterprise
Required Qualifications
7+ years in Product or Program Management, dealing with both technical and non-technical teams
Strong understanding of Manufacturing / Production and Quality processes and lifecycle
Excellent written / verbal communication and project management skills
Proven track record of being able to quickly acquire domain knowledge and build rapport with diverse set of stakeholders
Ability to balance requirements across engineering, data, and business stakeholders
Demonstrated success decomposing a problem into addressable component parts and arranging the correct sequencing
Proven ability to “see around corners” by crafting a strategy for 12-18 months into the future
Must be able to travel up to 33% of the time, as your stakeholders will be geographically dispersed
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. security clearance
Preferred Characteristics
Have expertise working with key Quality systems, including: Failure Reporting, Analysis, and Corrective Action System (FRACAS), Risk, Quality Management, AS9100 requirements, and Reliability
Understanding of digital thread concepts and the ability to define their plans for quality and reliability tooling within the wider Anduril digital engineering environment.
Familiarity with with quality management and planning digital tools.
Familiarity with with reliability engineering and simulation digital tools.

$154,000—$231,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
At Anduril we are developing cutting-edge artificial intelligence systems, command and control platforms, aerospace vehicles, and long range sensors. We are looking for systems security engineers with experience in these fields to help design and manage the security posture of the next generation of Anduril’s products. In order to be successful at Anduril, a systems security engineer needs to be fluent in areas of technical leadership, requirements-analysis, design rigor, and a hands-on contributor mindset. The Engineer must drive first principles of engineering in design rigor and integration with other systems internal and external to Anduril. In short this individual will have ownership in executing all security aspects of product development, production, and sustainment through the entire product lifecycle to assure product resiliency in adverse environments.


Responsibilities:
Illustrate security requirements and security architectures of multiple Anduril products
Design systems and solution features with engineering teams to meet and exceed industry-standard security goals
Develop, guide, and monitor technical documentation to capture trades studies, system designs, analysis, and results related to a systems security posture such as identifying Critical Program Information (CPI) and creation of Anti-Tamper Plans
Development and documentation of security test and assessment plans; Execution of demonstrations and support to customer-led validation events
Support technical work products developed by the larger engineering team, supporting major milestone deliveries (e.g: SRR, SVR, PDR, CDR, TRR, PRR).

Requirements:
Experience in one or more of the following fields: Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Cybersecurity
Experience with Government cybersecurity policy and frameworks such as JSIG, ICD 503, NIST SP 800-53
Previous work on security engineering and architecture on or related to defense and/or national security systems
Strong understanding of the “why” behind the product, systems, and security design
Ability to effectively brief and interact regularly with a technically-oriented government customer
A sincere commitment to a positive, inclusive, and collaborative culture
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
Must possess and be able to maintain a U.S. TS Security clearance

Preferred Qualifications:
Excels at the above listed Requirements
Proven track record of excelling across the broader security domain, encompassing embedded Systems Engineering, Cybersecurity, Software Security and Anti-Tamper Engineering
Experience working with unmanned aircraft at and above Group 3 class
Experience working with various operating systems and communication protocols
US Salary Range
$138,000—$207,000 USD

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
The Business Systems team is responsible for building and improving the many systems that enables Anduril to accomplish its mission. Anduril’s supply chain, accounting, sales & growth, engineering, modeling & simulation, field maintenance, manufacturing, and many more teams rely on the technology built and maintained by our team. We work across the company to ensure we have the tools and capabilities necessary for mission success.

We are seeking a highly skilled PLM Administrator to join our team. You will be responsible for helping product and program teams maximize the value they get out of the engineering systems they use on a daily basic (PLM, CAD, CAE, etc.). You will work across a broad set of stakeholders to design, develop, and implement improvements and optimizations to our engineering systems while helping steer future investments.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with engineering partners to understand their requirements and translate them into functional and technical solutions alongside other Engineer Systems team members
Provide training and support to users during and post-implementation to ensure adoption of new technology
Lead the development and implementation of new features, including defining project scope, requirements, timelines, and budgets
Collaborate with developers to identify and address issues, bugs, and enhancement requests from both Teamcenter and any integration to other systems (CAD, etc.)
Provide support for the installation and post go-live of upgrades and new modules within Teamcenter
Work with vendors and third-party service providers to implement upgrades and new modules
Collect infrastructure and configuration questions for Teamcenter and any integration to other systems (CAD, etc.)
Required Characteristics:
Anduril is an extremely fast-paced defense manufacturing and technology startup that is rapidly scaling itself. Our culture is one of ambition, hard work, relentless pursuit of excellence, and deliberate disruption. The successful candidate will be one who demonstrates the follow core characteristics:
Bias for Action - they ask for forgiveness, not permission, and hate the idea of waiting around to be told what to do
Dive Deep - they sweat the details and roll up their sleeves to uncover the root causes for systemic issues
Ownership - they care deeply not just about their systems, but for all the business outcomes that their systems supports as well, holding themselves accountable for everything it both does and fails to do
Agility - they change directions easily and without regret, quickly adapting to shifting business priorities
First Principles Thinking - they approach problems and develop solutions not based on what a vendor recommends or because it’s how they did things at their last job, but from a deep appreciation of what is best for the enterprise
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in installing, developing, implementing, upgrading, and maintaining Engineer Systems (PLM, CAD, CAE, SysML, etc.) with a preference on Siemens and Dassault
Understanding of CAD/CAM/CAE systems and their integration with PLM solutions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to root cause end user and infrastructure related issues.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Knowledge of both Windows and Linux systems, along with software installations
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. TS clearance
Preferred Qualifications:
Possess and be able to maintain a U.S. TS or Secret Security clearance 
US Salary Range
$124,000—$186,000 USD

Job Title: Business Development Associate Director, Mission Autonomy
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
The Mission Autonomy (MA) Business Development (BD) team within the Air Dominance and Strike (AD&S) Division at Anduril is responsible for identifying, shaping, capturing, and growing new opportunities and capabilities to make Anduril the leading provider of Autonomy Software for DoD. BD team members serve as the bridge between clients and the broader Anduril team; they convey client perspectives to other teams across the enterprise while also serving as the Anduril brand ambassador externally. MA BD team members are given significant autonomy in job function to empower them to deliver the best Autonomy Software to the DoD. They partner extensively with the broader AD&S division team, to include engineering and program management, to ensure that Anduril products exceed client expectations and mission demands and to drive continuous product improvements in response to client needs.
Role overview

What You’ll Do
Generate and capture business opportunities.The BD team is ultimately responsible for growing revenue. Specifically, this role will focus on building business for Lattice for Mission Autonomy (MA) software. This is achieved by developing a deep understanding of the existing and prospective client base, knowing the current or planned programmatic and technical roadmaps, and being cognizant of the competitive landscape. This expertise will inform capture strategies, revenue forecasts, and aid in technology development plans. Tactically, you will manage continuous engagements with current and future clients, generate growth strategies, and monitor buying cycles for opportunities, lead specific proposals and new capture efforts, and close contracts that unlock new business for the business line. Specific emphasis will be placed on candidates with experience in engaging with US Air Force unmanned and autonomous platforms and weapons, and a focus on organizations within the Defense Innovation Ecosystem, such as DIU and AFWERX.
Grow existing business. You will partner with adjacent business lines and product engineers to grow business with current clients. This does not simply include expanding upon current work, but also leveraging existing partnerships to explore new areas of work or opportunities by sustaining and building upon the strong foundation of those client relationships.
Communicate our value to clients. BD team members represent Anduril to a broad audience: clients, partners, competitors, and the interested public. You must project the company’s ethos, conveying insights that illustrate our approach to building next-generation defense technology and our competitive edges in doing so. 
Inform product development.As you will often be the first Anduril employee to engage a client, you are charged with translating their problem set back into our engineering organization. The team must trust your value judgement and assessment of the required mission outcome as you interpret and convey various client needs.  Internally, you will provide the necessary clarity to inform priorities, keep Anduril stakeholders informed, determine key milestones, and proactively provide clear communications to appropriate levels of the company. Your assessment of clients’ needs will inform new product decisions, and your ongoing engagement with clients will yield crucial input that helps Anduril ensure our product suite is best-in-class.
What we’re looking for 
Demonstrated Software Sales Experience within DoD or the Commercial Sector. We're looking for a candidate who has effectively led and closed software sales, preferably related to autonomous platforms and weapons within DoD. Furthermore, as a supplier of autonomy software for first- and third-party platforms and weapons, we seek a candidate who understands the procurement behaviors, ecosystems, and processes of Prime Contractors, government program offices, and defense innovation organizations. Pre-existing relationships with these customer communities are expected.
Mission First Mindset. We put the needs of the mission and our clients first. We actively seek out opportunities to better understand our clients’ mission needs, with a goal to build the best possible products for the warfighter and radically evolve our national and international defense capabilities. We push ourselves and the limits of our capabilities in the pursuit of this goal.
Ownership Mentality.We’re looking for owners; those who have a natural bias to assume responsibility, a healthy dose of skepticism, and contribute to a culture of performance. We empower our individuals to quickly assume high levels of responsibility and entrust them to actively own their account and shape its success.
Technical Aptitude and Intellectual Curiosity.We are first and foremost a technology company, working at the leading edge of capabilities like machine learning, autonomy, distributed networking, and multi-modal sensor fusion. These capabilities form the foundation of our product offerings, so we are looking for those who are comfortable communicating technical concepts and can articulate them in the context of the client’s mission. Candidates with an engineering or technical background are strongly preferred.
Structured Thinker and Problem Solver. Leading technical programs requires clear communication and well-thought-out plans. We are looking for assertive communicators who bring a thoughtful perspective and honest dialogue. A solution-driven approach, the ability to distill complexity into its essential, digestible components, and the ability to supervise execution are critical to ensure mission success.
High Value Team Member. Do you enjoy working as part of a team? At Anduril, the path to success weaves through the organization - account teams, engineering, logistics, technical operations, and more. It requires humility, an eagerness to learn, and empathy toward your fellow team member. We assume best intentions and empathize with clients just as we do with our colleagues. Can you develop rapport at both the user and executive levels? Do you enjoy sharing successes? We are a low ego group that promotes teamwork and collaboration to bring about success.
360 Degree Leader. We are a flat, non-hierarchical organization with a largely matrix structure that is dynamic and evolving. We expect you to be self-aware enough to recognize your position of unstated leadership within the company. You should have a demonstrated ability to lead and influence people through both formal and informal constructs and in situations where there is lack of clarity across teams. Finally, we need people who identify gaps and breakdowns and solve them immediately, rather than point them out and step back. You should also seek 360 feedback to help inform your growth trajectory as a leader.
Diversity & Inclusion.Our mission is reshaping our world. And at the heart of our mission is our people. Their diversity is our strength. They reflect the world in which we do business and the communities in which we live. We celebrate diversity and welcome applications from people of all walks of life and encourage you to confidently share your unique experiences with us. 
  Required Qualifications
Prior experience in DoD Capture and Sales, specifically related to software.
Experience with software across autonomous platforms and weapons. The preferred candidate will have work experience in the defense industry, specifically in autonomy software related to complex systems.
Ability to travel a 40-60% required.
Ability to interface with a wide range of US DoD and international customers.
Experience with government business development, government contract structures, and government proposal processes. The preferred candidate will have strong writing skills, with experience in writing white papers, RFI and proposal responses.
Experience with complex systems involving hardware and software.
Must possess and be able to maintain a U.S. Secret Security clearance
Preferred Qualifications 
Experience with commercial software sales or development a plus.
Expertise in AI and autonomous systems a plus.
STEM degree a plus.
Prior military or contracting experience can be helpful.
Must be eligible to obtain and maintain a U.S. TS clearance.
  US Salary Range
$140,000—$210,000 USD

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril's Command & Control Division is designing, developing, and deploying a next-gen software-defined, hardware-enabled distributed C2 architecture focused on orchestrating and automating 3rd party combat-fielded sensors and strike-platforms across heterogeneous networks in support of time-sensitive operations. We work with mission partners and operators to deploy reliable and robust capabilities on operationally-relevant fielding timelines to meet complex challenges across the DOD, IC and Allied partners.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Build a cohesive, data-driven strategy within the US Army C2 market to penetrate, expand, and deliver Anduril’s best-in-breed warfighting capabilities
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with critical Army stakeholders to identify new business opportunities, proactively communicate and resolve program issues, and provide strategic direction to program teams across operations, engineering, and manufacturing
Serve as the senior Army leader for programs within the C2 division and lead large capture campaigns against Program Executive Offices (PEO) within the Army acquisition community and across Senior Army leadership
Foster a culture of trust, open communications, customer focus, innovation, and continuous improvement
Lead initiatives that move the organization forward, contributing to business and financial performance in a material and meaningful manner
Deliver on financial performance commitments and build strategic market growth initiatives
QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal candidate will be a proven leader who has managed complex programs with the Department of Defense – ideally experience with the Army’s C3T PEOs
Intimate understanding of government contracting, fielding, and requirements generation for the purposes of transitioning prototype capabilities to production
A leader who can build, adapt, and implement new and innovative approaches to market
Experience in the technical, programmatic, and operational challenges of deploying warfighting capabilities in a Denied, Degraded, Intermittent, Low-bandwidth (DDIL) environment 
Must be able to work in a fast-paced, highly entrepreneurial, and creative environment
Demonstrated knowledge of relevant DoD Programs and platforms, related enabling technologies, systems integration, communications, software development
Demonstrated experience leading major acquisition programs directly with DoD or leading significant capture campaigns for a private sector defense company
Ability to identify, establish and use important customer relationships with senior level officials and program stakeholders within defense and intelligence community to drive capability adoption 
Demonstrated high-energy leader who will drive performance and exhibit strong management skills with a high level of emotional intelligence
Excellent writing, communication skills with experience briefing senior executives and customers
Preferred candidate is based out of Washington, DC
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Must possess and be able to maintain a U.S. TS/SCI Security clearance 
Must be willing to travel up to 35% 
Minimum of 5 years of relevant Program Management, acquisitions or business development / capture experience in the government and/or private sector

Job Title: Business Development Director, Rocket Motor Systems
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
The Business Development (BD) team within Anduril Rocket Motor Systems is responsible for identifying, shaping, capturing, and growing new opportunities and capabilities for the business line as part of its effort to become the leading SRM supplier in the US. BD team members serve as the bridge between clients and the broader Anduril team; they convey client perspectives to other teams across the enterprise while also serving as the Anduril brand ambassador externally. BD team members are given significant autonomy to empower them to disrupt the SRM industry and redefine the SRM industrial base. They partner extensively with the broader division team, to include engineering and program management, to ensure that Anduril products exceed client expectations and mission demands, and to drive continuous product improvements in response to client needs.


What You’ll Do:
Generate and capture SRM opportunities. The BD team is ultimately responsible for growing revenue. Specifically, this role will focus on building business for Anduril’s Rocket Motor Systems business line. Success will be achieved by developing a deep understanding of the existing and prospective customer base, knowing the current or planned programmatic and technical roadmaps, and being cognizant of the competitive landscape. This expertise will inform capture strategies and revenue forecasts and aid in technology development plans. Tactically, you will manage continuous engagements with current and future clients, generate growth strategies, monitor buying cycles for opportunities, lead specific proposals and capture efforts, and close contracts that unlock new business for the business line. Emphasis will be placed on candidates with experience in engaging US Air Force, Naval Aviation, and Army missiles communities.
Grow existing business. You will partner with execution teams and product engineers to grow business with current clients. This does not simply include expanding upon current work but also leveraging existing partnerships to explore new areas of work or opportunities by sustaining and building upon the strong foundation of those client relationships.
Communicate our value to clients. BD team members represent Anduril to a broad audience: clients, partners, competitors, and the interested public. You must project the company’s ethos, conveying insights that illustrate our approach to building next-generation defense technology and our competitive edges in doing so.
Inform product development. As you will often be the first Anduril employee to engage a client, you are charged with translating their problem setback into our engineering organization. The team must trust your value judgment and assessment of the required mission outcome as you interpret and convey various client needs. Internally, you will provide the necessary clarity to inform priorities, keep Anduril stakeholders informed, determine key milestones, and proactively provide clear communications to appropriate levels of the company. Your assessment of clients’ needs will inform new product decisions, and your ongoing engagement with clients will yield crucial input that helps Anduril ensure our product suite is best-in-class.
What we’re looking for:
Demonstrated Sales Experience in Weapons Systems or Solid Rocket Motors. We’re looking for a candidate who has effectively led and closed sales of weapons, missiles, or solid rocket motor systems. Furthermore, as an independent merchant supplier of solid rocket motors, we seek a candidate who understands the procurement behaviors, ecosystems, and processes of both Prime Contractors and government program offices. Pre-existing relationships with these customer communities are expected.
Mission First Mindset. We put the needs of the mission and our clients first. We actively seek out opportunities to better understand our clients’ mission needs, with a goal to build the best possible products for the warfighter and radically evolve our national and international defense capabilities. We push ourselves and the limits of our capabilities in the pursuit of this goal.
Ownership Mentality. We’re looking for owners; those who have a natural bias to assume responsibility, a healthy dose of skepticism, and contribute to a culture of performance. We empower individuals to quickly assume high levels of responsibility and entrust them to actively own their account and shape its success. The RMS BD team prides itself on the independence and autonomy that team members are given to identify opportunities, develop growth hypotheses, and execute their strategies.
Technical Aptitude and Intellectual Curiosity. We are, first and foremost, a technology company working at the leading edge of capabilities like machine learning, autonomy, and building autonomous air vehicles. Do you have a natural desire to see beyond simple cause and effect relationships to really understand how complex systems operate? Do you actively seek out opportunities to educate yourself? These capabilities form the foundation of our product offerings, so we are looking for those who are comfortable communicating technical concepts and can articulate them in the context of the client’s mission.
Structured Thinker and Problem Solver. Leading technical programs requires clear communication and well thought-out plans. We are looking for assertive communicators who bring a thoughtful perspective and honest dialogue. A solution-driven approach, the ability to distill complexity into its essential, digestible components, and the ability to supervise execution are critical to ensure mission success.
High-Value Team Member. Do you enjoy working as part of a team? At Anduril, the path to success weaves through the organization - account teams, engineering, logistics, technical operations, and more. It requires humility, an eagerness to learn, and empathy toward your fellow team members. We assume best intentions and empathize with clients just as we do with our colleagues. Can you develop rapport at both the user and executive levels? Do you enjoy sharing successes? We are a low-ego group that promotes teamwork and collaboration to bring about success.

Required Qualifications:
Ability to travel 50% required.
Prior experience in Defense Capture related to Missiles, Weapons Systems, or solid rocket motors.
Experience with missile systems across a range of domains. The preferred candidate will have work experience in the defense industry or U.S. DOD, specifically in the missiles or weapons capability area.
Ability to interface with a wide range of U.S. Department of Defense and international customers.
Experience with government business development, government contract structures, and government proposal processes.
Comfortable with personally setting and achieving goals in a complex environment.
Comfortable with working in limited resource environments.
Must be able to obtain a Secret Clearance. Existing Secret/TS Clearance a plus.
Locations:
Preferred: Costa Mesa, CA (HQ), Washington, D.C, or Huntsville, AL. Remote work will be considered for exceptional candidates.
  US Salary Range
$168,000—$252,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. We are looking for a manager to establish, lead, and scale our Physical Security operations at our HQ Campus. We are responsible for protecting people, R&D, manufacturing, and critical infrastructure. Reporting to the Global Physical Security Manager, you will work cross-functionally across the company to mitigate physical security risk across all systems and supporting business objectives. If you have a demonstrated record in physical security, enjoy the challenges of building operations from scratch, and want to grow a department tasked with solving complex security problems for Anduril, we want to hear from you.
Here's what you’ll do:
You will assist in the development of physical security programs, taking into consideration security policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and operational systems through the business lens to provide the level of protection needed to support company objectives.
You will assist in regional staffing: identifying, developing, implementing, and maintaining security processes across the organization to reduce risks, respond to incidents, and limit exposure to liability in all areas of financial, physical, reputational, and personal risk.
You will coordinate and implement site security operations to ensure the protection of executives, managers, employees, and physical/information assets.
You will oversee the management (training, SOPs, staffing, and auditing) of the guard force teams at our HQ Campus and nearby facilities.
You will develop and maintain close relationships with high level law enforcement counterparts.
Here’s who you are
A minimum of 3-5 years of physical security experience with a history in a leadership position at a high growth company.
Project management skills. You have experience with high profile/high visibility projects, timelines, and milestone tracking.
Understanding of executive protection requirements and code of conduct.
Ability to manage emergencies with level-headedness.
Crisis and incident management training.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a strong sense of empathy and the ability to successfully advocate for your team.
Bring a highly risk averse mindset to your work and seek to balance that against business constraints and competing priorities & objectives.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
US Salary Range: $70,000 - $105,000

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Systems engineering and prioritization
Accountable for the management, architecture and technical execution of several small drone system products delivering to multiple business lines.
Producing high quality simulations, analysis, tests, verification processes to guide product design
Ability to decompose complex systems into functional parts, with clearly defined interfaces and requirements for each
Requirements derivation and validation
De-risk technical objectives and manage team prioritization
Setup trade spaces and guide decisions around “how the system comes together”
Unblock engineering progress. This spans from RCA efforts on critical engineering issues to finding mechanisms to unblock the functional teams where stuck
Identify “what is missing” or “what is important but not being managed”
Accountable for the shared technical output of the team
Recognition of internal customer needs and ability to support the objectives of the business
Technical management
Define milestones that break up delivery into manageable chunks
Manage a delivery schedule
Balance short term “urgent” needs with long term “important” needs
Define technical success criteria for the deliverable
Align team priorities through reviews and cross-functional meetings
Manage and escalate risks (“if it’s not on track, are you raising the flag to get the team help before it’s broken”)
Assist in creation of customer, executive review, and product-team materials
Assist in customer and program management
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in a senior role leading system design and development from initial concept through test and delivery to customers
Basic understanding of Aerodynamics, Seeker Technology, Inertial Measurement Units (IMUs), Control Actuation Servos, Modeling and Simulation and how those disciplines relate to overall system performance
Bachelor’s degree in a technical field-preferred Robotics, Physics, Mechanical, Electrical, or Software engineering, and/or equivalent experience in a relevant field
Experience with data analysis, rapid prototyping, and early-stage customer deployment
Hands-on build and prototyping of complex robotic systems
Familiarity with concepts of mechatronic design, firmware + software system design, sensor physics, tracking & calibration, and data-backed decision making
Ability to engage technically with mechanical, electrical, firmware, sensors, and robotics software leads
Ability to lead a cross-functional team through design trades while meeting program deadlines
High ownership, mission-oriented mentality. Desire to see the product meet the end need of the customer
Extremely organized and detail-oriented, with strong verbal & written communication skills
A sincere commitment to a positive, inclusive, and collaborative culture
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
Ability to travel as required for test planning and execution
US Salary Range
$206,000—$309,000 USD

Lead technical execution from vision & initial design, through fabrication, test and production
Develop systems that support expeditionary operation, intuitive setup and use by warfighters, and modular expansion of sensors.
Setup trades to enable exploration of early designs while working closely with technical SMEs and Business Development teams to find the right solution for current and future gaps in capability.
Operate at the intersection of software and hardware.
Define product milestones, lead technical design reviews, guide cross-functional product decisions, manage engineering risk.
Coordinate the fabrication of prototype and low-rate production articles and subsystem/system level test efforts
Work with senior leadership to ensure resource plans are adequate for work scope
Support remote troubleshooting and operation of deployed systems
Conduct hands-on, in-field testing
Create and carry out a verification and validation plan for the end to end system

Experience in a senior role leading system design and development from initial concept through test and delivery to customers
Bachelor’s degree in Robotics, Physics, Mechanical, Electrical, or Software engineering, or equivalent experience in a relevant field

Extremely organized and detail-oriented, with strong verbal & written communication skills

Ability to travel as required for test planning and execution

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO: 
Systems engineering and prioritization
Responsible for executing a technical roadmap for an integrated missile system of systems
Produce and interpret high quality simulations, analysis, tests, verification processes to guide product design
Ability to decompose complex systems into functional parts, with clearly defined interfaces and requirements for each
Requirements derivation and validation
Create and carry out a verification and validation plan for the end to end system
De-risk technical objectives and manage team prioritization
Setup trade spaces and guide decisions around “how the system comes together”
Unblock engineering progress. This spans from RCA efforts on critical engineering issues to finding mechanisms to unblock the functional teams where stuck.
Identify “what is missing” or “what is important but not being managed”
Accountable for the shared technical output of the team
Operate at the intersection of software and hardware helping to craft a system level architecture that supports a robust and cost effective design
Define product milestones, lead technical design reviews, guide cross-functional product decisions, manage engineering risk
Coordinate the fabrication of prototype and low-rate production articles and subsystem/system level test efforts
Work with senior leadership to ensure resource plans are adequate for work scope
Conduct hands-on, in-field testing
Recognition of internal customer needs and ability to support the objectives of the business
Technical project management
Define milestones that break up delivery into manageable components of scope
Manage a delivery schedule
Balance short term “urgent” needs with long term “important” needs
Define technical success criteria for the deliverable
Align team priorities through reviews and cross-functional meetings
Manage and escalate risks (“if it’s not on track, are you raising the flag to get the team help before it’s broken”)
Assist in creation of customer, executive review, and product-team materials
Assist in customer and program management
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in a senior role leading system design and development from initial concept through test and delivery to customers
Basic understanding of Aerodynamics, Seeker Technology, Inertial Measurement Units (IMUs), Control Actuation Servos, Modeling and Simulation and how those disciplines relate to overall system performance
Technical Bachelor’s degree in Robotics, Physics, Mechanical, Electrical, or Software engineering, and/or equivalent experience in a relevant field
Experience with data analysis, rapid prototyping, and early-stage customer deployment
Hands-on build and prototyping of complex systems
Familiarity with concepts of mechatronic design, firmware + software system design, sensor physics, tracking & calibration, and data-backed decision making
Ability to engage technically with mechanical, electrical, firmware, sensors, and robotics software leads
Ability to lead a cross-functional team through design trades while meeting program deadlines
High ownership, mission-oriented mentality. Desire to see the product meet the end need of the customer
Organized and detail-oriented, with strong verbal & written communication skills
A sincere commitment to a positive, inclusive, and collaborative culture
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
Ability to travel as required for test planning and execution
US Salary Range
$154,000—$231,000 USD

Anduril is a defense technology company, bringing Silicon Valley talent and funding to the defense sector. Our technology helps our customers solve their toughest challenges by enabling them to make better, more informed decisions in life-and-death situations. We’ve assembled a diverse team of experts in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor fusion, optics, and data analysis that are creating software and hardware solutions to radically evolve the capabilities of the United States and our allies. If you are passionate about solving problems that have real impact, come join Anduril and build the future of defense.

A Comms Architect will be responsible for creating and leading a team of cross disciplined engineers to develop/design/prototype/build and eventually field resilient communications products. An ideal candidate is someone who has 10+ years of military comms waveform experience, wireless systems, digital signal processing, systems engineering, product development, and leadership skills.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Design Resilient Communication Systems
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of software and hardware engineers to develop software defined radios
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong experience with DSP implementation for embedded devices and/or software defined radios
Waveform design for resilient communications
Extensive experience with embedded devices, including FPGA, GPU, ARM, and Software Defined Radios
Familiar with wireless communication standards both commercial and DOD (Bluetooth, 3G/4G/5G, Wi-Fi, SINCGARS, MUOS, etc.)
Excellent at balancing multiple projects at any given time
Project Management and Leadership experience
Enthusiastic about both working with a team and executing work
25% travel required
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. security clearance
Salary Range: $200K - $309K

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Own hardware design from initial requirements through handoff to full production.
Work on mechanical designs that involve the tight integration of complex thermal solutions, RF hardware, PCBAs, and cabling.
Prototype rapidly in order to find issues quickly and develop a final product on compressed timelines.
Support critical customer facing hardware demonstrations and use these interactions to better understand the customers’ requirements.
Travel to test sites as needed.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience in an immersive technical project (collegiate project teams or professional settings)
5+ years of mechanical design experience in a professional setting
CAD skills (any platform) and ability to make high quality engineering drawings that meet common industry standards
Demonstrated hands-on fabrication skills and ability to root-cause and adapt quickly to manufacturing issues
High competence with, and fluid use of, engineering first principles
Experience with integration of PCBAs and other electronics into a mechanical system
BSME, MS or PhD in a related engineering field
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data
Ability to get security Clearance

Experience in Solidworks/Teamcenter
Experience with designing passive and active thermal management into mechanical designs
Experience with designing hardware with EMI constraints
Experience with designing parts for various manufacturing methods such as CNC machining, sheet metal, injection molding, and 3D printing
Experience working closely with electrical engineers, software engineers, manufacturing engineers

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Create, maintain electrical system test strategy, and test plans for various Anduril Electronics Warfare (EW) and Radio Frequency (RF) products
Analyze and drive coverage and analysis of failures observed in integration, characterization and system level testing.
Integration testing of electrical subsystems and functionality
Facilitate electrical system performance, calibration, durability, and environmental testing of developmental hardware per test plan
Develop and maintain test standards, design and develop test equipment or procuring and handling purchased test capital equipment to support test readiness
Act as a liaison to conduct ground and flight testing and support field test team during tests
Leverage data analysis and existing tools to reproduce and characterize failures
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
General understanding of engineering concepts, principles, and theory with technical experience demonstrating the application of those concepts while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Electronics, and Computer Engineering or related fields
6+ years of relevant industry experience with emphasis on hardware validation and verification testing.
Demonstrate experience in RF test methods, systems, and equipment with experience in the application
Familiarity with Python and/or MATLAB for data parsing and data visualization
Ability to travel to and work at remote sites supporting test integration, commissioning and training as required
Familiarity with electrical test equipment such as multimeters, oscilloscope, spectrum analyzers, signal generators and vector network analyzers
Strong root cause analysis skills
Excellent written, verbal, interpersonal and communication skills
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. TS/SCI security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
6+ years of relevant industry experience
Pursuing a Master’s of Science or PHD in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Computer Science or related field
Experience with RF design and integration
Demonstrated knowledge of regulatory compliance standards

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s Electronic Warfare department is in pursuit of a Technical Product Manager to lead our efforts in streamlining the collaboration between our frontend, backend, and embedded teams. The role is central to executing and influencing the vision for our products, working closely with stakeholders across all engineering disciplines.
As a Technical Product Manager, you will master the art of organizing chaos, ensuring that efforts are aligned and milestones are met. You will be expected to adeptly use tools like JIRA to manage projects, while also having the flexibility to adapt agile methodologies to suit our team's unique requirements. Your technical proficiency should include familiarity with digital signal processing (DSP), radios, and hardware human-machine interfaces (HMI).
The right candidate for this role is someone who is extremely organized, capable of navigating and thriving amidst the dynamic environment of our Electronic Warfare department. You should be exceptional at dealing with difficult people, influencing product decisions, and bringing order to complexity.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to organize projects spanning frontend, backend, and embedded systems.
Execute product roadmaps and refine the product vision in alignment with company goals and user needs.
Engage with stakeholders across all engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery of software solutions.
Utilize JIRA to manage the workflow, while tailoring agile practices to fit the team's unique project requirements.
Leverage your knowledge of DSP, radio technology, and hardware HMI to drive the development of innovative products.
Maintain a high level of organization and structure within the team to navigate and manage the inherent complexities of our projects.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
5 - 10 years in software product development, with at least 5 years specifically in a hands-on product management capacity
A deep understanding of back-end and front-end web technologies & distributed systems to consider capabilities and limitations
Strong JIRA experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional organizational skills and proficiency in managing complex software development projects.
Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams and drive product decisions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
An agile mindset with the ability to adapt processes to meet the unique needs of the team and projects.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. TS/SCI security clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Hands-on experience with digital signal processing, radio technology, and hardware interfaces.
Experience working in a developer focused product team
Active TS/SCI clearance helpful but not required
US Salary Range
$168,000—$273,000 USD

Job Title: Technical Product Manager, Electronic Warfare - Active Clearance
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril’s Electronic Warfare department is in pursuit of a Technical Product Manager to lead our efforts in streamlining the collaboration between our frontend, backend, and embedded teams. The role is central to executing and influencing the vision for our products, working closely with stakeholders across all engineering disciplines.
As a Technical Product Manager, you will master the art of organizing chaos, ensuring that efforts are aligned and milestones are met. You will be expected to adeptly use tools like JIRA to manage projects, while also having the flexibility to adapt agile methodologies to suit our team's unique requirements. Your technical proficiency should include familiarity with digital signal processing (DSP), radios, and hardware human-machine interfaces (HMI).
The right candidate for this role is someone who is extremely organized, capable of navigating and thriving amidst the dynamic environment of our Electronic Warfare department. You should be exceptional at dealing with difficult people, influencing product decisions, and bringing order to complexity.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to organize projects spanning frontend, backend, and embedded systems.
Execute product roadmaps and refine the product vision in alignment with company goals and user needs.
Engage with stakeholders across all engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery of software solutions.
Utilize JIRA to manage the workflow, while tailoring agile practices to fit the team's unique project requirements.
Leverage your knowledge of DSP, radio technology, and hardware HMI to drive the development of innovative products.
Maintain a high level of organization and structure within the team to navigate and manage the inherent complexities of our projects.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
5 - 10 years in software product development, with at least 5 years specifically in a hands-on product management capacity
A deep understanding of back-end and front-end web technologies & distributed systems to consider capabilities and limitations
Strong JIRA experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional organizational skills and proficiency in managing complex software development projects.
Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams and drive product decisions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
An agile mindset with the ability to adapt processes to meet the unique needs of the team and projects.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. TS/SCI security clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Hands-on experience with digital signal processing, radio technology, and hardware interfaces.
Experience working in a developer focused product team
Active TS/SCI clearance helpful but not required
US Salary Range
$168,000—$273,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
We are looking for a Component Test Engineer to join our team!
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Lead and own End of Line test plan definition for new products and new features, in collaboration with firmware, software, and hardware design teams
Determine test strategies that optimize product safety, product reliability, risk mitigation, FMEA coverage, and schedule
Design and execution of PCBA and electrical system components with hands on testing and rework as necessary
Data analysis and clear communication of results and collaboration with design engineers to resolve any product problems found via test
Design and implement next generation test automation hardware systems to facilitate fast and repeatable testing of product
Manage purchasing, build, integration and final commissioning of functional testers
Develop test procedures and test automation from component level to system level
Support board bring-up and bench validation as needed
Support Design Engineer with DFT, provide feedback from test results to improve quality and test coverage
Support manufacture test bring-up and yield
Support quality field failure analysis
Familiarity with measurement analysis techniques such as Gage RR and Process Capability Analysis
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineer or equivalent
5+ years of experience designing functional test equipment and PCBAs
Experience in Schematic Capture and PCBA layout.
Knowledge of scripting language to develop automation. Python, Matlab, PERL or SHELL. Experience in LabVIEW is a plus
Understanding of peripherals and developing test and validation strategies
Experience with computer hardware communication bus protocols: USB, I2C, I2S, CSI, Ethernet, SPI, PCIe, HDMI, CAN, etc
Understanding of memory hierarchy and developing test and validation strategy
Understanding of Product Release Cycle from prototype to production and key deliverables of each phase
Collaborate with a cross-functional team to support product development from prototype to production
Experience with hands-on electrical engineering work
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Understanding both hardware and software integration and test process
Advance proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and VISIO
Understanding of lab safety protocols when working in all types of lab environment
A detail-oriented individual who strives in an environment that values effective team collaboration
Self-motivated: Demonstrate ability to set direction and proactively identify and fills gaps where needed
  US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Full cycle PCB design including collecting requirements, schematic design, component selection, supervision or completion of layout, bring-up, test, debug and system integration
Troubleshoot issues that span the electrical and software boundaries, with solid skills using both lab equipment (Oscilloscopes, DMM, etc.) and basic software debugging tools
Development of payloads and subsystems (sensors, payload interfaces, power management, and networking)
Develop system interconnect diagrams and define wire harnesses that connect electronic equipment within a subsystem
Work closely with other electrical, mechanical, software, firmware, and test engineers to deliver fully functional products
Conduct peer-level and cross-discipline design reviews
Low level firmware development for bring-up and test
Concurrently manage involvement in multiple projects at various stages
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent, with 5+ years of experience designing, testing, and troubleshooting complex board designs
Knowledge of modern analog and digital electronics and electronic circuits.
Competence with test equipment such as oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, thermal chambers, current-probes, and automation of tests.
Familiarity with standard interfaces such as Ethernet, CAN, I2C, SPI, PCIe, USB, etc.
Familiarity with common MCU, CPU, FPGA devices and technologies.
Comfortable with a variety of electronic CAD tools (Altium preferred, Eagle and others acceptable)
Experience in design for signal integrity / power integrity
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export controlled data.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with high speed PCB design
Experience with power systems including batteries and AC power
US Salary Range
$120,000—$180,000 USD

Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.

16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
