ABOUT THE JOB 

We are looking for a Logistics Program Manager to join our rapidly growing team in Costa Mesa, CA. As Logistics Program Manager, you’ll play a critical role in support of a growing development program and will be responsible for all developmental logistics tasks. Your goal will be to establish technologies using standard principles, theories, concepts, and techniques to provide solutions to a variety of technical problems. Position must be able to work independently and will have sole responsibility to deliver Logistics CDRLs. This will require a breadth of understanding of both commercial and military logistics, the ability to work across teams seamlessly, and a deep appreciation for details. For this position, we are searching for an individual who can bring experience working on government programs to Anduril and help us continue to scale our capabilities in government and DoD logistics. Goal is for this position to convert into the long term sustainment lead position for this development program.

We are a fast-growing company at the early stages of our growth, and you will be expected to own material and important projects during your time on the team which will have a significant impact on the Program’s trajectory. Anduril fosters a diverse, collaborative, culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership and professional growth.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Manage all phases of the program from conceptualization through completion, including acquisition, planning, and managing technical performance to ensure quality, business, and financial objectives are attained.
Develop and coordinate logistics CDRLs.
Participate with engineering to establish design concepts, criteria, and engineering efforts for product research, development, testing, and integration.
Interact with internal and external representatives at various levels concerning resolution of technical and scheduling issues. Act as primary contact for Logistics/Sustainment program issues.
Influence, and coordinate the preparation of proposals, business plans, proposal work statements and specifications, operating budgets, and financial terms/conditions of contract(s). Influence contract acquisitions, negotiations, and modifications.
Ensure technical leadership and excellence is maintained by participating in the planning, attraction, selection, retention, and development of the required management, professional, and technical talent.
Act as the primary customer contact for Logistics/Sustainment program activities and may lead program review sessions with customers to discuss cost, schedule, and technical performance.
Manage the development of and ensure the security of proprietary technology and maintain the strict confidentiality of sensitive information..
Problem solve and remove obstacles for your team and internal and external partners. Know how to think critically and engage the right teams to help.
Communicate effectively to keep internal and external teams informed at all times. Use the necessary channels (Slack, email, meetings) to ensure stakeholders understand what needs to be accomplished and when.
Be a team player where no task is too small. Be willing to roll up your sleeves and get the job done. Embrace the startup life.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
A degree in engineering, science, business/operations or a related technical field as well as 5+ years of progressively complex program or logistics administration experience with at least three of those years managing. May substitute equivalent experience in lieu of education.
Demonstrates technical expertise and application of logistics management principles, concepts, and practice as well as leadership skills including organizing, planning, scheduling, and coordinating workloads to meet established deadlines or milestones.
Must be able to develop solutions to problems that require coordination of technologies across program requirements.
Strong communication, leadership, presentation, and interpersonal skills are required to enable an effective interface with other departments, all levels of management, professional and support staff, customers, potential customers, and government representatives.
Customer focused, must be able to work on a self-initiated basis and in a team environment, and able to work extended hours and travel as required.
Experience with US Military program offices is desired.
Government Proposal experience is desired.
U.S. Person status is required because the role requires access to export controlled information

Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. The Operations team manages the end-to-end processes take enable Anduril to build, ship, and deploy products at scale. As part of the Operations team, we’re looking for an individual to help solve key cross-functional process, analytics, and systems projects to better help Supply Chain, Deployments, and partner teams across a variety of workflows. 

WHAT YOU"LL DO
You’ll work closely with the Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Mission Operations, Finance, Product, and Deployments teams to identify problems, conceive solutions, and implement processes to improve our ability to buy, make, and deploy hardware quickly and correctly.
You’ll work closely with the Analytics and Business Systems teams to scope requirements and deliver solutions to help aid in solving core scale problems.
You’ll lead cross-functional efforts, building project roadmaps, getting alignment from different parties, and working through roadblocks as they come up, owning the end-to-end implementation of a given initiative.
You’ll develop and utilize your strategic operations viewpoint, being an active participant in deciding which projects are even worth solving at a given point in time, and understanding the different priorities and considerations from a variety of functions to enable you do so.
You’ll pinch hit where necessary, filling in critical gaps to ensure the business can smoothly.
You’ll identify consistent pain points and develop and iterate on processes to help the company solve issues over time.
You’ll use your qualitative and quantitative skill set to help create key analysis to influence and execute on operational decisions.
You have product taste and are able to think through how business systems requirements should be shaped, and partner with Arsenal on conceiving and testing workflows.
You’ll communicate across teams, bridging different parts of the organization to achieve cross-functional outcomes.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
You have an insanely high execution bar and will see projects through from conception to tactical completion to move Anduril forward.
You consider people, and you love solving complex, ambiguous, cross-functional problems in a people-centric way.
You’re both high ownership and low ego, approaching everything with strong outcome orientation and high humility.
You’re genuinely curious and creative, wanting to dive deep into a variety of operational process and systems problems and think critically to define optimal solutions.
You’re observant and anticipate cross-functional issues/need and potential solutions before the broader org may notice.
You’re tactical and don’t only sit at a 30,000 foot level.
You’re discerning and an incredibly fast learner.
U.S. Person Status is required as this position needs to access controlled data.

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril’s Deployment Operations group is seeking a Technical Operations Engineer to join our team. This is a Costa Mesa based role and not eligible for remote/hybrid work.
  As a member of Anduril’s Technical Operations team, you will be responsible for deploying and supporting Anduril’s products all over the world. You will go forward with products early on in their lifecycle and work with engineering teams to iteratively improve them over time. The challenges you will encounter are innumerable and unpredictable, but you will be expected to take ownership of delivering the technical solution.
  You must be both a teacher and a student, able to coach teammates on systems that you’ve gained intimate familiarity with and then transition into mastering the next system. You’ll also guide users through product employment and troubleshooting, advise account managers on how to structure an operation to ensure technical success, and communicate specific recommendations for product refinement to engineering teams.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Ability to gather requirements from end-users. Communicate and teach complex subjects with clarity and simplicity. Able to build trust cross-functionally, navigate customer hierarchies, and influence teams in a peer-leadership capacity.
Proven ability to master a technical system and support it in austere environments. Must demonstrate an innate drive to be self-sufficient across the breadth of a technical system.
Strong aptitude for problem solving in unstructured situations at the interface of hardware, software, and networking. Ability to drive challenging and vague technical problems to clarity and resolution.
Naturally inquisitive, able to independently research and learn new technical components or concepts.
Ability to develop complex operational and logistics plans to move people and things quickly, over long distances, in unfamiliar locations.
U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data.
Willingness to travel to remote regions of the world for up to two months at a time.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field
Prior military or overseas contracting experience.
Ability to hold and maintain a US DoD S/TS security clearance
Familiarity with Linux OS. Comfortable obtaining data from software platforms using command-line tools.
Strong mechanical aptitude with tools and electronics.
  US Salary Range
$112,000—$168,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:
Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.
For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.
For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.
Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.
Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.
16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.
Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.
Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.
A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.
Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.
Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.
Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).
401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only)

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
  As a member of the Technical Operations team, you will serve as a bridge between product engineering and deployed operations. You will practice extreme ownership of all dependencies to ensure that Anduril’s growing suite of capabilities achieve total mission success in austere, remote environments. To this end, you will be embedded within an air vehicle development program where you will leverage your operations and technical expertise to shape and deploy a solution of maximum effectiveness and reliability. Your scope will include standing up forward-deployed operations in austere environments, ensuring the successful combat employment of Anduril products, and shaping the long-term sustainment of these products. In addition, you will be a core participant in customer demonstrations and test events closer to home.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Extensive hands-on (field operations, manufacturing, or test) technical experience
Hands-on professional experience working with UAV’s or equivalent military experience as a UAV operator, maintenance technician, or Crew Chief
Demonstrated understanding of flight operations, aircraft systems, and sensors
Demonstrated ability to solve problems in unstructured situations at the interface of hardware, software, and operations in pursuit of mission success
Experience working with cross-functional engineering teams and external customers; demonstrated ability to collect differing opinions and reconcile them in order to achieve agreement on what ‘right’ looks like
Experience performing data-driven root cause analysis on complex systems
Strong computer and documentation experience
Demonstrated ability to train peers or customers on the operation of a product
Willingness to travel up to 80% including occasional deployments for up to two months at a time
Able to work extended hours as required
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering or related discipline
Hands-on professional experience working with developmental weapon or missile systems on manned and/or unmanned aircraft
Experience with one or more of:
Ground-based air defense systems, either sensors or effectors
Operations and maintenance of airbreathing propulsion systems
Aircraft or launch vehicle flight line operations
Munitions storage and handling controls
Experience developing code in higher level languages (e.g. Python, MATLAB) for analytical modeling and data reduction

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHY WE’RE HERE 
The C2 Systems Technical Operations Engineering team is looking for a technical operations engineer with the skills to adeptly prepare, execute, and provides unwavering support for intricate product installations within highly secure environments.

As a member of the C2 Systems Technical Operations Engineering team, you will serve as a bridge between the product engineering and deployment operations organizations. You will be expected to practice extreme ownership of all dependencies to ensure that Anduril’s growing suite of highly integrated hardware-software capabilities achieve total mission success in all environments.

To this end, you will work alongside a product development team where you will leverage your operations and engineering experience to shape and deploy a solution of maximum effectiveness and reliability. Your scope will vary between products but can include focus areas as disparate as:
Reliability engineering
Deployment at scale
Incident triage and root-cause analysis
Logistics
Software tooling and user-experience improvements
Pre-deployment testing and configuration
Workflow automation, and development of acceptance test procedures
In addition, you will be a core participant in customer demonstrations, events, and early deployments Anduril’s integrated C2 products. The knowledge you gain in these deployments will inform product development efforts and allow you to instruct others on the deployment and operation of the product.

Technical Operation Engineering team members are expected to be deeply familiar with Anduril’s joint all domain command and control (JADC2) offerings and will holistically support end-to-end customer success. 
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
California based; comfortable working with a distributed team
Extensive hands-on (field operations, systems administration) technical experience
Demonstrated ability to solve problems in unstructured situations at the interface of hardware, software, and operations in pursuit of mission success
Experience working with cross-functional engineering teams and external customers; demonstrated ability to collect differing opinions and reconcile them in order to achieve agreement on what ‘right’ looks like
Experience performing data-driven root cause analysis on complex systems
Demonstrated ability to train peers or customers on the operation of a product
Experience working within Linux based operating systems
Up to 50% travel, to include travel to remote and/or austere environments for up to 1 month at a time
Experience overcoming intricate software complexities to deliver successful outcomes
Demonstrated ability to serve as a technical subject matter expert on the setup, maintenance and sustainment of complex hardware systems in DoD or commercial environments
Independently execute basic maintenance and hardware component swap operations should systems or subsystems fail; travel to customer deployment sites with limited notice to fix critical system failures
Knowledge of commercial satellite communication pathways and associated equipment
Ability to logically troubleshoot RF communications equipment and network systems
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret security clearance 
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, or a related technical field
Hold a DoD 8570 IAT Level 1 or 2 certification
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
Experience installing, sustaining, and troubleshooting data systems for DoD or otherwise sensitive customers
Familiarity with DoD-managed network enclaves (NIPR, SIPR, etc.)
Military service background
Experience with military voice and data line-of-sight and beyond-line-of-sight communications capabilities, to include but not limited to HF, VHF, and UHF
Familiarity with the operation, configuration, and maintenance of currently-fielded military transceivers and receivers used in tactical and non-tactical environments
Understanding and skill to configure and maintain a wide variety of Type I encryption devices
Technical expertise in computer networking, to include understanding of hardware and software interconnection
      US Salary Range
$112,000—$168,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
As a Deputy Program Director, you will be responsible for the overall program execution of Anduril Weapons and/or Aircraft Programs across various stages of the contract lifecycle. This includes leading the IRAD risk reduction, preliminary design review, critical design review and production readiness review. You will be working closing with the customer and be focused on winning this competitive program. You will be responsible for overall cost, schedule and technical execution teaming with the Chief Engineer. You will be responsible for teaming with the manufacturing team to establish a manufacturing plan to support the Low Rate Initial Production (LRIP) for the program. You will be leading the Earned Value Management reporting for the program.  In addition to leading the planning, execution, and delivery of all programs and projects, you will oversee the strategic coordination of these functions to ensure optimal outcomes, customer satisfaction, and overall business success. Finally, you will be teaming with the Missile or Aircraft Business Line Leads and Missile or Aircraft Growth Leads to drive the expansion of the portfolio for new business which is synergistic with this program. The program director must be a strong leader motivating a team under schedule pressures.
  WHAT YOU'LL DO: 
Program Management:
Develop and implement effective processes, tools, and metrics for program planning, scope management, risk management, and overall program execution.
Develop strong customer relations through regular communication.
Ensure successful coordination and integration of engineering, R&D, and IRAD expenditures with manufacturing, safety, business development, and administrative functions.
Collaborate with stakeholders to align goals, optimize processes, and streamline communication across functions.
Monitor and manage program progress, ensuring adherence to cost, schedule, and resource allocation targets.
Foster a culture of teamwork, continuous improvement, and effective program execution.
Ensure Earned Value Management is used to track progress of program execution and drive course corrections as needed.
Ensure program milestones are met to maintain a position in the competitive program.
Understanding of critical chain management to drive program execution at a rapid pace.
Strategic Planning:
Collaborate with senior management to develop and refine the strategic roadmap for Anduril Weapons or Aircraft Programs.
Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and customer requirements to identify growth opportunities and develop business strategies.
Drive the integration of engineering, R&D, and IRAD expenditures into the strategic planning process, ensuring alignment with the company's mission and vision.
Identify areas for process improvement, technology adoption, and innovation across functions to enhance overall performance and efficiency.
Champion cross-functional collaboration efforts to ensure seamless integration and successful delivery of programs.
Financial Management:
Ensure that engineering, R&D, and IRAD expenditures are managed in a financially responsible manner, monitoring budgets and implementing corrective actions when necessary.
Responsible for program P&L, schedule, and technical performance on internal investments and program funds for this development weapon program
Collaborate with finance and business development teams to develop accurate cost estimates and pricing strategies for proposals, ensuring alignment with customer expectations and internal financial targets.
Oversee the integration of financial planning and reporting across functions, providing insights and guidance to senior management on financial performance and risks.
Identify potential risks, cost overruns, or financial constraints, developing mitigation strategies and coordinating with stakeholders to drive successful outcomes.
Team Leadership and Development:
Foster a positive and high-performance culture within the program team, promoting employee engagement, professional development, and retention.
Proactively assess team skills and resource requirements, identifying training needs or recruitment opportunities to strengthen the team’s capabilities.
Provide mentorship, coaching, and guidance to program managers and team members, nurturing their growth and success.
Encourage and promote adherence to company policies, procedures, safety standards, and ethics guidelines.
  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
Minimum of 15 years managing Defense Contracts and Defense Acquisition
Proven track record of successfully managing complex, multi-million-dollar programs and driving their on-time, on-budget completion
Deep understanding of contractual earned value and earned value management systems
EVMS certified or EVMS applied experience as an , IPT Lead, Program Manager, Engineering Director 
Expert knowledge of government procurement regulations as they pertain to bid/costing proposals
Demonstrated financial acumen and ability to manage program budgets effectively.
Preferred experience working on programs related to Missile/Weapons systems or Aircrafts.
Strong strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex information clearly and concisely to diverse audiences.
Proficient in project management software tools and Microsoft Office Suite

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
We're looking for a Compensation and Benefits professional to join our People Operations team. You will drive Anduril’s success by bringing your compensation and benefits expertise to our People leadership team and helping us scale. You will utilize and combine your prior high growth company experience, quantitative rigor, business mindset, and communication skills to understand our business priorities, oversee and evolve our internal People processes, design optimal compensation programs, and align with our performance management practices. You will be a trusted advisor to our leadership team and a critical leader on the People team.
WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Lead Global People programs and projects, enabling Anduril to scale it’s People infrastructure in the most impactful and sustainable way.
Work closely with our People Analytics team to drive analytical rigor and deep analysis on effectiveness and competitiveness of existing programs; establish and drive key metrics including usage, engagement, and cost analyses.
Lead change management and communications of Total Rewards practices with managers, team members, and across the People Team.
Lead the team through regular benchmarking cycles to analyze and assess market data, industry trends, and best practices to create market competitive reward packages.
Drive our Benefits, Compensation, and Operational approach as related to growth of our company.
Set national and global compensation bands as Anduril expands their global footprint.
Build strong partnerships with the People Business Partner, Talent, Payroll, Legal, Stock, Finance and Accounting teams as well as our 3rd party vendors.
Strategize with the Talent Acquisition team to develop competitive offers rooted in market data and aligned with our compensation philosophy for new hires and existing employees.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: 
8+ years of experience working within People organizations (or equivalent) in roles requiring you to driving operational excellence cross-functionally across multiple groups or departments.
5+ years of experience in Compensation and Benefits, including Equity design, planning, M&A, Benefits leadership, and evolving strategies due to acceleration of the organization.
Extensive exposure to building and successfully executing Compensation, Total Rewards strategies for hyper-growth technology companies.
Track record of effectively partnering with a Board/Compensation Committee as well as internal senior stakeholders.
Deep analytical skills with the ability to translate data and trends into key insights and recommendations; financial prowess and ability to build and manage budgets, models, etc.
Proven ability to track, prioritize and drive to success multiple concurrent projects with a strong operational background.
Proven record in strategy and execution of People Operations including HRIS and processes.
Hands-on leader. You're resourceful, forward-thinking, drawn to building from ambiguous and unsolved problems and have an "own the outcome" mindset.
Influence and partnering with a diverse group of stakeholders, able to partner with deeply technical as well as operational, business-minded leaders on key Compensation and Benefits topics. You excel at openness and flexibility with internal clients, balanced with maintaining consistency in Total Rewards philosophies and practices.
You devote time to and are passionate about educating, mentoring and teaching partners the values and business impact behind total rewards and comprehensive HR processes.
US Salary Range
$145,000—$215,000 USD

As a Hardware Recruiting Coordinator at Anduril, you will play an integral role in helping our software teams grow & scale. From helping to handle daily recruiting coordination activities to encouraging candidate relationships and experiences along the way, you will be pivotal in helping fuel the company for tomorrow's success. Often you will be providing prospective candidates & new hires with their first impression of Anduril.
Our Hardware Recruiting Coordinators work closely with our Technical Recruiters, Sourcers, Hiring Managers, and Interviewers to support the growth of our fast-paced organization. This role is an integral part of the team and is responsible for managing all interview scheduling and related logistics. Excellent candidate experience will be your goal, and you'll be our invaluable partner in helping guide candidates through Anduril's interview process. You possess excellent communication skills. You can shift gears at a moment's notice while being able to think proactively. And most importantly, you enjoy challenging yourself while helping to scale a world-class organization. Anduril has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together, we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking, and, above all, collaborative.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Manage all logistics related to interview scheduling from receipt of scheduling request to conclusion of interview process
Assist prospective candidates with travel and hotel accommodations using our self-serve online booking tool, Egencia
Update candidate records and manage interview coordination requests in Greenhouse (ATS) and Prelude (scheduling tool)
Navigate interviewers' complex and dynamic schedules
Correspond with candidates via phone, text, and email
Find opportunities for interview process and system improvement, including identifying bottlenecks and improving candidate experience and scheduling efficiency
Greet candidates with poise and confidence while facilitating the onsite interview process, ensuring an excellent candidate experience
Build strong relationships with key stakeholders (Recruiters, Sourcers, Hiring Managers, Interviewers, Executive Assistants, Recruiting Coordination team)
Participate in ad hoc project work to support the Recruiting Coordination team 
QUALIFICATIONS
Prior experience as a Recruiting Coordinator (at a fast-paced, growing company)
Candidate-first mentality
Able to work efficiently and prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment
Relentless attention to detail and accuracy
Great team player but can also work well independently with limited guidance
Process-driven with strong habits and a passion for process improvement and efficiency
Strong verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on providing good customer service and building strong relationships
Ability to remain composed and detail-oriented in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Positive attitude with a growth mindset
Willing to work in-person at Anduril's Costa Mesa Office 4-5 days per week
BONUS POINTS
Experience using ATS applications (Greenhouse experience strongly preferred)
Proven experience scheduling within Outlook
Familiarity with Slack
Experience using Prelude
Experience working with asynchronous and geographically diverse teams
Experience coordinating interviews for growing hardware teams
  US Hourly Range
$25—$37.50 USD

  Responsibilities:
Serve as a strategic thought partner to business owners on people-related strategies and employee engagements
Develop deep relationships and build trust with key business owners
Provides guidance and input on business unit restructures, workforce planning, and succession planning
Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues. Conducts effective, thorough, and objective investigations
Autonomously lead the design, implementation, and iteration of new people programs, as well as assess and improve current people programs
Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention
Provides HR policy guidance and interpretation
Utilize people metrics to drive key insights and decisions around growth and retention

Data-driven and detail-oriented

People Generalist

Role Overview
The People Generalist is an essential member of Anduril's People Operations team. They have a wealth of HR knowledge and experience, and they're great at supporting ongoing HR needs. They're the go-to person for any employee issues and always put policies and compliance first. They're in charge of ensuring that the new hires at their worksite have a fantastic onboarding experience, making them feel comfortable and welcomed from day one. The People Generalist is a strategic thinker who leads HR projects with enthusiasm and dedication, always making sure that the project is completed on time and aligns with the company's goals. They're also ready to occasionally serve as a mentor to junior team members, helping them develop their skills and grow professionally. They're always happy to collaborate with their peers and strive to create a positive work environment where everyone feels valued and motivated.



Responsibilities
Support the business partner team and act as an escalation point for employee questions and tickets.
Document, maintain, and communicate core HR processes to stakeholders, managers, and employees.
Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and programs aligned with organizational goals.
Oversee HR compliance activities to ensure adherence to employment laws and regulations.
Provide guidance and support to employees regarding HR-related inquiries.
Lead HR projects and initiatives, conduct periodic audits for data accuracy and compliance.
Mentor junior HR team members and collaborate with People Operations leadership to align strategies and initiatives.
Coordinate the on-site onboarding process for new employees, collaborating with internal teams.
Serve as one of the primary points of contact for new hires, providing assistance and resolving issues.
Maintain onboarding materials and documentation with updated company information.
Facilitate orientation sessions to convey company culture, and performance standards.
Traits and Experience
Strong knowledge of HR policies, procedures, and best practices, including employment laws and regulations.
3+ years of experience in HR or People Operations.
Commitment to excellence, detail-oriented, and adept at multitasking.
Discretion — you know how to maintain confidentiality but also recognize what needs to be escalated.
Ability to function independently and problem-solve with minimal or no direction.
Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, ensuring data integrity and compliance.
Proficient in using HRIS and other HR-related software systems.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with employees at all levels.
Passion for service and commitment to empathy, kindness, and patience.
Adaptability in a fast-paced work environment.
US Salary Range
$90,000—$135,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
As a Recruiting Coordinator at Anduril, you will play an integral role in helping our company grow & scale. From helping to handle daily recruiting activities to encouraging candidate relationships and experiences along the way, you will be pivotal in helping fuel the company for tomorrow's success. Often you will be providing prospective candidates & new hires with their first impression of Anduril.
Our Recruiting Coordinator will work closely with our Recruiters, Sourcers, Hiring Managers, and Interviewers to support the growth of our fast-paced organization. This role is an integral part of the team and is responsible for managing all interview scheduling and related logistics. Additionally, this person will play a role in identifying areas for improvement and efficiency gains. Excellent candidate experience will be your goal, and you'll be our invaluable partner in helping guide candidates through Anduril's interview process. You possess excellent communication skills. You can shift gears at a moment's notice while being able to think proactively. And most importantly, you enjoy challenging yourself while helping to scale a world-class organization. Anduril has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together, we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking, and, above all, collaborative.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Manage all logistics related to interview scheduling from receipt of scheduling request to conclusion of interview process
Assist prospective candidates with travel and hotel accommodations through Egencia
Update candidate records and manage interview coordination requests in Greenhouse (ATS) and Prelude (scheduling tool)
Navigate interviewers' complex and dynamic schedules
Correspond with candidates via phone, text, and email
Find opportunities for interview process and system improvement, including identifying bottlenecks and improving candidate experience and scheduling efficiency
Greet candidates with poise and confidence, facilitate the onsite interview process, and ensure an excellent candidate experience
Build strong relationships with key stakeholders (Recruiters, Sourcers, Hiring Managers, Interviewers, Recruiting Coordination team)
Lead and participate in project work to support the Recruiting Coordination team
QUALIFICATIONS
Experience as a Recruiting Coordinator or in Recruiting (at a fast-paced, growing company)
Candidate-first mentality
Able to work efficiently and prioritize tasks in a dynamic environment
Relentless attention to detail and accuracy
Great team player but can also work well independently with limited guidance
Process-driven with strong habits and a passion for process improvement and efficiency
Strong verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on providing good customer service and building strong relationships
Ability to remain composed and detail-oriented in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Positive attitude with a growth mindset
Willing to work in-person at Anduril's Costa Mesa Office 4-5 days per week
BONUS POINTS
Experience using ATS applications; Greenhouse experience strongly preferred
Proven experience scheduling within Outlook
Familiarity with Slack
Experience using Prelude
Experience working with asynchronous and geographically diverse teams

$25—$37.50 USD

As the Senior Program Manager for the People Team, you will own the data that informs the operational decision making at Anduril. In this role, you will partner with leadership and teams from across the business to unpack ambiguous problems and build lasting, scalable solutions. Your work will vary from quick-turn analytical problem solving to process and data improvements and building core dashboards and tables — all in the pursuit of helping grow how Anduril operates and measures itself. Join us in helping increase the velocity of the organization by becoming an expert on our most critical workflows such as talent acquisition, people operations, benefits, compensation, and so much more.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:
You’ll both lead and help on critical projects for leaders in our People org, requiring you to quickly learn new subject matters and create priorities in an ambiguous situation.
You have an insanely high execution bar and will see projects through from conception to tactical completion to move Anduril forward.
You’ll use your qualitative and quantitative skill set to help design key analysis to influence and execute on operational decisions, and partner with analysts to execute.
Work deeply within data team and systems team, becoming intimately familiar with how our business systems (HRIS, etc.) function, and how to leverage data from them to create insights and analytics (leveraging tools like Excel, SQL, Tableau), equipping functional teams with these insights and tools to measure and improve their processes.
You’ll communicate across teams, bridging different parts of the organization to achieve cross-functional outcomes.
Own operational projects end-to-end, from Definition, Solution, to Implementation. You will be handed ambiguous, messy problems with little prescription on how to solve them.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
You have experience in management consulting, investment banking, internal operations, or business analyst role.
You are motivated by our mission. We are working to solve the biggest problems in defense.
You thrive in cross-functional projects that have a heavy combination of technical requirements and user-focused workflows.
You get energy from being a thought partner for others and it excites you to spend time creating process.
You are empathetic: you are eager to see the world from your users’ perspective.
You love solving complex, ambiguous, cross-functional problems in a people-centric way.
You’re both high ownership and low ego, approaching everything with strong outcome orientation and high humility.
You don’t wait on others to solve problems. You proactively step into the gap to offer solutions yourself.
You are comfortable communicating broadly and having a lot of eyes on your work. This role can at-times require communications to large groups and senior leadership. This should excite you!
US Salary Range
$114,000—$171,000 USD

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. Anduril’s Legal Team seeks a Compliance Director with a focus on the full spectrum of cUAS, AI, and robotics regulatory issues. This includes everything from providing legal oversight to product development, giving legal guidance to existing business areas, to crafting legal and business strategies. The Legal Team partners closely with customers, outside counsel, and business partners across the organization to support business development and day-to-day legal operations.

Anduril is a fast-growing company at the early stages of growth. Consistent with this fast growth, members of Anduril’s Legal Team must be resourceful, creative, and eager to take ownership of complex matters. The Compliance Director role will require creativity and resourcefulness to navigate the US Government’s broad set of compliance laws and regulations, with a singular focus on helping Anduril deploy its path-making technology into operational settings for the United States and its allies. In addition to helping managing aviation, spectrum and export control compliance, you will work on all other aspects of Anduril’s business, from negotiating license and services agreements, facilitating the supply chain, advising on product development, to international expansion. Experience across all of these areas is not expected, but a willingness to learn and adapt is.

The Compliance Director will be expected to take responsibility for both significant, material projects, which will have a significant impact on the company’s business as well as larger process and strategic planning for the Compliance team. Anduril is growing from a tech startup to a manufacturing powerhouse and the Compliance Director will play a critical role in scaling our operations. Our team is passionate about the law and policy of defense technology and you should have an independent interest in the key issues in this field. Anduril fosters a diverse, collaborative, culture with tremendous opportunities for ownership and professional growth.
WHAT YOU’LL DO
Report to the Senior Director to provide support and oversight over programmatic, helping to develop and implement compliance programs and procedures to ensure adherence to relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
Ensure process scale with the company alongside the other domain-specific Compliance attorneys while helping the Compliance team keep the impact on engineering teams to an minimum and optimizing on speed to market.
Drive customer growth by managing the regulatory requirements to develop, deploy and operate Anduril products. Use your expertise in compliance to help the Business Development, Proposal, and Engineering Teams efficiently capture new contracts, grow existing contracts, and ensure timely and uninterrupted performance. Assist in the strategy development for new business.
Manage relationships with Government regulatory agencies. High-trust professional relationships with Government regulatory offices are critical to Anduril’s continued success, and you will be called upon to develop and foster these relationships throughout your tenure.
Work on all legal aspects of Anduril’s business, from negotiating license and services agreements, facilitating the supply chain, advising on product development, to international expansion. You will represent the legal team in relationships with outside counsel, vendors, engineers, executives, customers, and regulators.
Represent the company in regulatory inquiries, audits, and investigations, ensuring timely and appropriate responses to regulatory authorities
Represent the Senior Director of Compliance and other compliance attorneys within the company to expand the Compliance team’s ability to provide in-person guidance and support across a variety of compliance issues.
Represent the Senior Director of Compliance and other compliance attorneys
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS 
A mix of
5+ years of experience with export controls, including jurisdiction and classification analysis and license applications for both the EAR and ITAR (or UK or EU equivalents)
5+ years of experience with spectrum management laws and regulations (US, UK, or EU)
5+ years of experience with aviation laws and regulations (US, UK, or EU)
The judgment and initiative required to own multiple projects from end-to-end, whether guiding engineering teams through the lifecycle of an export license or handling unexpected legal issues that may arise in defense or start-up companies
Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a proven track record of managing complex legal matters and providing strategic advice to senior management.
Quick learner and able to contribute to the broader start-up legal function, including topics that may be completely new to you: everything from IP and litigation to financing, securities, compliance, and employment law, depending on the needs of the day
Must be able to obtain and hold a U.S. top secret security clearance
Licensed to practice law in CA or DC
Wiling and able to work in Anduril’s CA office
Willing and able to travel at least 15% of time
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Pre-law school professional experience
Combination of law-firm and in-house/government experience
Experience working with the Department of Defense while in private practice
Experience with engineering, software, or other technology
An interest in the law and policy of AI, UAV, spectrum and trade control with opinions about what is right or wrong in the field and how to fix it
Engineering background in the software, mechanical, or electrical engineering fields
Engineering background, particularly in the electronics, radar, or radio spaces
  US Salary Range
$222,000—$290,000 USD

You will help provide extensive paralegal, operational, and administrative support to our multi-disciplinary team. Our responsibilities include contracts negotiation, knowledge management, increasing overall operational effectiveness by implementing new processes, and special projects. Anduril is a fast-growing company at the early stages of our growth, and we're excited about our team's impact on the company’s business. Anduril fosters a diverse, collaborative, and innovative culture with plenty of opportunities for ownership and professional growth.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Monitor intake mechanisms and workflows to facilitate the smooth and timely daily operations of the department
Prepare, review and redline contracts, e.g., NDAs, SaaS licenses, vendor contracts, engagement letters, teaming agreements, etc.
Coordinate electronic signatures and maintain contract records and filings
Identify opportunities to improve processes, share best practices, and improve efficiency with the Legal team’s organizational structure
Develop, implement, and/or improve centralized resources and internal tools to ensure they are well maintained and accurate
Support and manage various ad hoc projects within the team as needed
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong written and verbal communications skills and excellent attention to detail and accuracy
The ability to build strong relationships within the team and cross-functionally including Procurement, Finance, and Growth/BD
Solutions oriented, experience developing and streamlining processes and creating efficiencies
Willing to wear multiple hats with shifting priorities and work on projects of all types, big and small
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
A positive, team player attitude, good judgment, and eagerness to help others
At least 1 year of relevant experience
Bachelor's degree and/or paralegal certificate
U.S. Persons status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Interested in national security and changing the landscape of defense contracting
Experience with startup, defense, and/or in-house legal teams preferred but not required

Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Own engineering efforts through hands on development and applying your expertise in software best practices
Drive career growth, engagement and quality output of engineers on your team
Contribute to Firmware Engineering direction, policy and guidance
Develop low-level firmware/software for microcontrollers, create reusable device drivers, integrate system-level features and architect changes to support an ever-growing codebase
Quickly debug and troubleshoot issues that span the electrical, firmware, and software boundaries
Participate in hiring, group level leadership discussions and decision making
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
BS or MS in CS/CE/EE or equivalent industry experience
Strong C coding ability for embedded systems
Excellent communication skills
Experience developing firmware in bare-metal or RTOS environments
Debugging skills with JTAG, SWD, Oscilloscopes, and Logic analyzers
Solid experience with common bus protocols such as USB, SPI, I2C, CAN, RS232, RS485, Ethernet, etc.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction
Experience with one or more microcontroller cores (ARM, AVR, MSP430, PIC, etc.)
Have a bias for action. If you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it

Job Title: Environmental Health and Safety Manager, Test Sites
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Anduril is looking for an Environmental Health & Safety Manager (Test Sites) to join our rapidly growing team. As Environmental Health & Safety Manager, you’ll be responsible for Anduril’s safety and environmental policies, processes, and procedures primarily at our test sites and secondarily at our HQ supporting R&D. You’ll understand all federal, state, and local regulations and industry best practices, and work to improve Anduril’s processes.

You’ll roll up your sleeves from day one and jump right in, both crafting plans and strategies, while also owning the tactical responsibilities of the job yourself. You’ll partner with a variety of individuals, including our Testing and Evaluation, Technical Operations, Manufacturing, and Facilities teams, working to craft cross-functional improvements to our operations. You will serve as the primary EHS resource to our Testing and Evaluation teams.
Responsibilities
Lead day-to-day EHS operations and process management at all Test Sites (Texas, California, Oregon, and Nevada)
Design and create policies for employees to follow that minimize job-related hazards in our field testing and deployment environments in concert with site leadership
Develop and conduct safety training according to appropriate regulations
Develop and maintain strong communication (both written and verbal) from the field back to the EHS team for futher SOPs and curriculum development
Site compliance with federal, state, local, and landowner regulations
Conduct safety audits at sites and build improvements
Maintain, develop or implement site specific environmental policies which include but are not limited to:
Hazardous and non-hazardous waste management
Air permitting
Spill prevention/response
Storm water management
Waste water
Incident and injury response
Coordinating with and serve as the main point of contact for local regulatory agencies
Who You Are
Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years or 8+ years of related experience in manufacturing/assembling, R&D operations is required.
You have experience with Federal and State OSHSA regulations, and the ability to monitor and interpret new regulations.
You understand the materials we use and implement handling policies based on regulations and best practices like range safety, laser safety, battery handling and disposal, etc.
You have a strong attention to detail and an attitude of 100% compliance with all company and regulatory requirements.
You are a strong independent worker who can drive outcomes with minimal oversight.
You are skilled in developing and maintaining excellent working relationships with internal teams, customers, and business units.
You are extremely organized, proactive, responsive, and upbeat with strong organizational skills.
You’re both high ownership and low ego, approaching everything with strong outcome orientation and high humility.
Advanced use of MS Word, Excel, Slack, Outlook; other productivity tools.
50% travel will be required (domestic)
U.S. Person status (US permanent resident or US citizen) is required as this position
  US Salary Range
$70,000—$135,000 USD
  The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
The Flight Test and Evaluation Team at Anduril performs validation of Group 5 UAS. We work in close coordination with specialist teams like, Guidance, Navigation, and Control, Flight Sciences, Mission Systems, and Aircraft Maintenance to solve some of the hardest problems facing our customers. We are looking for instrumentation engineers and Group 5 unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) developers excited about implementing a powerful instrumentation, telemetry, and data management system for flight test of Group 5 UAS.

As a Flight Test Instrumentation (FTI) Engineer at Anduril, you will dive into unique, complex challenges that come with the territory of high-stakes, advanced technology in the defense sector. Your expertise will drive innovation in autonomous systems, shaping the future of defense and intelligence with solutions that are deployed at unparalleled speed. If you're eager to leverage your instrumentation and RF telemetry skills in an environment that encourages bold ideas and offers the resources to turn them into reality, Anduril provides the perfect platform to propel your career and make a tangible difference in a world entering a new era of strategic competition. Join us and be part of the transformation that's setting new standards for military capabilities and security.


WHAT YOU'LL DO
Conduct requirements decomposition using a wide array of digital tools to select and install only the necessary flight test instrumentation, and effectively communicate analytical insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate cross-functionally with UAS discipline engineers, the Customer, Airworthiness subject matter experts, and program managers to inform safety of test, safety of flight, strategic decisions, and positively impact 'speed-to-ramp'.
Spearhead technical investigations to diagnose instrumentation and RF telemetry issues, providing leadership in the interpretation of data and formulation of solutions to improve system reliability and efficiency.
Design and implement analytics-driven customer-facing products that showcase system performance metrics, provide trend analysis, and enhance user understanding and experience with our Group 5 UAS platforms.
Design, fabricate and install flight test instrumentation sensors, data paths and equipment into one of a kind experimental aircraft, often utilizing novel approaches. This includes the fabrication of wire harnesses and routing through aircraft structure, often working directly with other integrated product teams to support program goals.
Perform test instrument calibrations and pre-flight checks in conjunction with discipline and manufacturing engineers as an approving signatory for GO/NO-GO flight test decisions
Operate and maintain a telemetry auto-tracking Ground System using COTS software and hardware
Travel from Anduril HQ to establish FTI and RF telemetry solutions in the high desert of California, Nevada, Texas, and Oregon up to 50% of the time.

CORE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Mechatronics Engineering, or a related field. Alternatively, Radar Systems, Data Science experience, with a strong quantitative and mechanical measurements foundation.
5+ years notable experience with embedded data acquisition systems in manned or unmanned aircraft.
Exceptional data visualization skills, with proficiency in using analytical tools (e.g., MATLAB, LabVIEW, Simulink) to advise the translation of complex data into accessible visual formats for diverse audiences.
Demonstrated expertise in implementing high channel count (e.g. 100-400 measurands) mechanical measurement systems and architecting RF telemetry for near real-time display in a control room.
A proven track record of implementing and troubleshooting grounding, bonding, and shielding solutions for analog-to-digital instrumentation signals in multi-band RF environments.
Experience with composite and exotic material installations across varying flight test environments.
A strong commitment to applying data science to solve real-world problems, with the ability to translate technical findings into actionable recommendations that have a tangible impact.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to engage effectively with multidisciplinary teams, including engineers, program managers, and non-technical stakeholders.
Able to work extended hours as required.
Ability to travel as required for test planning and execution
Ability to immediately obtain a U.S. Top Secret-Level security clearance.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Master of Science or B.S. plus 10 years experience with flight test instrumentation on Group 5 UAS and high-gain, Aeronautical Telemetry Auto-tracking Ground System using COTS software and hardware.
5+ years experience setting up and administering high channel-count, RF telemetry systems with the Interactive Analysis and Display System (IADS).
Knowledge of best practices for implementing RF ground planes and architecting RF telemetry systems for maximum RF range on composite aircraft systems
Leadership experience, with the ability to mentor less experienced discipline engineers and lead project teams in the execution of complex data acquisition initiatives.
Experience working with 'Data-at-rest' multi-domain, encrypted storage devices on aircraft.

Job Title: Principal Flight Test Engineer - Weapons Programs
Content Intro: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.
This position is looking for a highly motivated, highly experienced lead flight test engineer with emphasis in developmental test of weapon and missile systems, with experience performing program management responsibilities. You will work heavily with the program leadership and a wide spectrum of cross-departments to help build a team focused on solving hard problems and changing the industry forever. The role will be responsible for planning, coordination, execution and reporting on all facets of the test program.

The Test and Evaluation team at Anduril works across the entire spectrum of products and business lines, as well as all flight operations and test range management. Our team conducts full system level development testing, new production acceptance testing, sub-component qualification testing and much more. In short, if it involves test, we support it. If you are interested in working in an extremely innovative and fast paced environment, where your work directly makes an impact and difference in the products that are fielded this a fantastic opportunity.



WHAT YOU’LL DO
Act as lead test engineer for missile or weapon systems to include development, certification and integration test of subsystems to the AUR configuration.
Lead a team that will plan and execute full system level T&E of hardware and software with emphasis placed on resource planning, conducting ground and flight test, initial issue investigation, and process improvement/development.
Work closely with program management and other engineering department leads to develop requirements, communicate test campaign schedule and progress, establish test campaign gates and milestones, and discuss test results to include collected data and observations.
Lead a team to conduct ground and flight testing at private and government-owned test ranges
Plan, execute, and report on lab, ground, and flight test as required
Oversee test data collection efforts and perform initial data analysis for the system under test.
Work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
A bachelor's degree in engineering or a related technical discipline from an accredited institution. May substitute equivalent engineering experience in lieu of education.
10+ years of experience as a lead test conductor/test director for developmental weapon or missile systems on manned and/or unmanned aircraft to include requirements development, test planning and execution, and test reporting
Experience with system engineering or Department of Defense (DoD) program processes, (EVM, MIL-STD-881 etc.)
Previous experience with and/or current working knowledge of MIL-STD-8591, MIL-STD-2088, MIL-STD-1553, MIL-STD-1760, AS8775, AS5653, etc.
Experience integrating and conducting test with suspension, arming, and release equipment
Previous experience or familiarization with military missile system airworthiness certification standards and process (ADS-45-HDBK, Seek Eagle and NNMSB, ECT.)
Must possess the ability to understand new concepts quickly; apply them accurately; organize, schedule, and coordinate work phases; and, determine the appropriate approach at the task level or, with assistance, at the project level to provide solutions to a range of complex problems.
Must have a complete understanding of engineering concepts, principles, codes, and theory; experience demonstrating a broad application of those concepts; and, expanding knowledge of principles, concepts, theory, and practices in related technical specialties.
Previous expertise and working knowledge of the National Airspace System and UAS operating rules and regulations thereof.
Strong computer and documentation experience.
Must have strong communication (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team; able to perform complex tasks in one or more engineering areas.
Ability to travel as required for test planning and execution
Able to work extended hours as required
Bias for action – if you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it
Ability to immediately obtain a U.S. Top Secret-Level security clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
A Master’s degree in engineering or a related technical discipline from an accredited institution. May substitute equivalent engineering experience in lieu of education.
Prior experience with software code/script building using programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, etc.
Prior experience with Linux based systems and command line.
Working Knowledge with COTs Small UAS autopilot and mission planning software.
Experience working with manned aircraft personnel and familiar with aviation terminology.
Experience with weapon or tactical datalinks.
Experience with multiple different propulsion systems to include air and non-air breathing

Job Description:
Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. This position will be filled by a highly motivated Field & Service Mechanic with a passion for developmental flight test of a new and revolutionary Group 5 UAS, and experience performing maintenance test lead/manager responsibilities. You will work heavily with the Maintenance Lead and a wide spectrum of cross-departments to help build a team focused on solving hard problems and changing the industry forever. A Service Mechanic for Group 5 UAS is responsible for the maintenance, repair, and upgrades of the mechanical systems on large unmanned aircraft systems. This role requires a deep understanding of sophisticated systems, as well as the ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues that affect the performance and safety of the aircraft.

The Test and Evaluation team at Anduril works across the entire spectrum of products and business lines, as well as all flight operations and test range management. Our team conducts full system level development testing, new production acceptance testing, sub-component qualification testing and much more. In short, if it involves test, we support it. If you are interested in working in an extremely innovative and fast paced environment, where your work directly makes an impact and difference in the products that are fielded this a fantastic opportunity.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
Experience with Tool Control, FOD, HAZMAT, Training, Quality, and Security programs.
Execute pre-flight and post-flight checks and services, ensuring readiness for operations.
Troubleshoot, repair, and maintain aircraft and subsystems including landing gear, fuel system, flight control, and propulsion.
Coordinate with logistics teams to manage parts inventory and ensure availability of necessary maintenance supplies.
Complete aircraft and equipment documentation,
Troubleshoot, repair, and maintain site support equipment.
Prioritize maintenance tasks in accordance with departmental needs.
Provide on-the-job training and mentorship to junior service technicians and mechanics.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to optimize maintenance procedures and workflows.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Able to travel as required (up to 50%)
Must be able to obtain and hold a security clearance
Must have been previously awarded a 5 or 7 Skill level USAF AFSC, Navy/Marine MOS discipline rating or an equivalent Airframe and Power Plant, FAA instrumentation license.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
Willing to be multi-capable. Which shall include some electronics troubleshooting and repair
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Ability to rapidly change roles/responsibilities while working in a fast paced, challenging work environment
Capable of standing, walking, bending, and climbing for extended periods.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
A&P with Inspection Authorization
Developmental test experience
Proficient with computer use (standard browser, word processing applications)
Experience reading engineering drawings, blueprints and interpret/translate instructions to specific maintenance mechanics/technicians
Experience with aircraft subsystems and components, preferably with Group 5 UAS or similar large aircraft

WHAT YOU'LL DO
This position will focus heavily on small UAS integration and test efforts tailored to achieve mission critical objectives using Lattice.
Integration and development testing of core Lattice product R&D
Integration, regression, and operational flight testing of Lattice software releases
Test duties include system level T&E of hardware and software; planning and execution of ground and flight tests, resource management, process improvement/development, and participating in technical test reviews.

Own mission objectives, triage issues, and delegate tasks as required to promote project success.
Collect and perform initial test data analysis for the system under test.
Support execution of testing at private and government owned test ranges.
Work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices.

3+ years test and evaluation experience to include flight test
Ability to travel as required for planning and testing.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team; able to perform complex tasks in one or more engineering areas.
Able to work extended hours as required.

Prior experience with Pixhawk flight controllers running Ardupilot and PX4 for air vehicles, including setup, operation, and tuning.
Prior small UAS / drone experience.
FAA Part 107 certification.
Experience working with the Department of Defense (DoD)
Prior experience with software code or script building
Bias for action – if you see a problem, you want to solve and fix it
